Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ashcoffey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ina perfect location just off La Rambla, plenty of bars and restaurants at your doorstep. It's within walking distance to the port where you can catch all the tourist buses. The hotel itself isn't 5 star quality but unless you are a couple planning on spending quality time in your hotel room, it's not a problem!! staff at reception were a bit odd and quite unhelpful but quite easy to figure things out for yourself. A taxi to here from the airport was around €30, we got in late at night but otherwise the bus from the airport is only about a 19 minute walk away and only costs €5.30. Really cannot fault this place excellent location, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Location”
Reviews.Author: MIKE R
Reviews.Content: Stayed 17th April for 3 nights. Great location. Room was clean, tidy and made every day. It wasn't a huge room, but we didn't go on vacation to stay in the room and watch Spanish TV. ;-) We were a little worried about noise as this seemed to be a common factor in most hotels, but we didn't hear a thing. Their was no view from the hotel room - but again, we didn't want to spend time in the room looking out the window when there is heaps more to do. Reception staff were friendly. Location was great, within easy access to the Metro and sights. Can't fault this hotel. Would recommend it to everyone. Reasonably priced, good location. Didn't have breakfast, so can't comment on this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: auntygail
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a weekend break in Barcelona and this hotel was recommended by friends. We went on a room only basis at a good rate. We did not try the breakfast so cant comment on the quality. We had a small room but it did not cause a problem as it was somewhere to sleep whilst enjoying this fantastic city. We did have a small balcony but at the side of the hotel so no fantastic views! The only small problem was the location as we were situated next to the vending machine which caused a constant hum all night long - not conducive to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “great location but!!!”
Reviews.Author: teresa231
Reviews.Content: First impressions from the outside of this hotel were good, but after checking in and given our room Number 201 things changed. The room was very small, but clean, but the biggest problem we had was the window. We had no natural light from this, as it was covered with a metal grid, so that you could not see outside, but hear the lift going up and down all day and night, This room overlooked the lift shaft!!!! We could not leave the window open because of the noise, and then with the air con on, trying to sleep was almost impossible. Use this hotel for the location and surrounding area, but at all costs avoid ROOM 201.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star Hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Lou1626
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights and requested and got a room in a quiet location on the top floor and were lucky to have a patio with chairs and plants. The room was a good size with a nice bathroom and very clean. Breakfast is OK and we got ours included for a good price but I wouldn't want to pay a lot for it. The Hotel is in a nice area with some good eating places and Cafe Schilling across the road which is nice for drinks and snacks. Customer service at the Hotel especially in the Breakfast room could be better but overall it's a good base for a break in the fab city of Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 night stay at the Rialto. Hotel is conveniently placed for access to Las Ramblas and the Gothic Quarter. Hotel is a good 3 star standard, nice reception, reasonable staff, and the rooms are clean and well kept, if a little small. We had a room on the first floor directly overlooking the courtyard, and close to the adjoining restaurant. Although this could be a little bit noisy, all was generally quiet by 12 midnight, and never caused us any problems - a day walking around Barcelona is enough to ensure you could sleep on a pin! The only down point was the breakfast - by way the poorest we have experienced in any hotel of this standard elsewhere in Europe, and by the third day we were down to just taking the bread roll, butter and ham. The cooked items were inedible. We booked B+B but couldn't help noticing that the breakfast, if booked seperately, cost 14 Euros - definitely not good value! Would use this hotel again, but would take breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, perfect location !”
Reviews.Author: Oradea-mary
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for those coming to visit Barcelona ! Less than 5 minutes to Rambla and metro station Lyceum, 2 minutes to Bari Gotic and the Catedral, 5 minutes to Plaza Catalunya. On the other side of Rambla is Market Boqueria, a must in Barcelona! the rooms are good, clean, toiletries in the bathroom, only the smell in some bathrooms (they said because of the rainy weather). Breakfast very good, lots to eat (warm and cold stuff, fruits, coffee, cakes and others). The only thing not to do: DO NOT ASK THE RECEPTION TO BOOK AND BUY YOU TICKETS TO FOOTBAL GAME TO NOU CAMP. THEY CHARGE VERY HIGY COMMISION AND NOT WILLING TO GIVE YOU BILL FOR THE AMOUNT YOU PAY!!. go direkt to Nou camp or to the offices they have (on the rambla for example) and buy there the tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - could not find anything to complain about”
Reviews.Author: Maevey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more that we expected. As usual European city centre hotels are small but our room was small with everything you could need for a 4 day break. Room was very clean, plenty of towels, bright and exactly what we needed after walking around all day. We had a room overlooking the front of the hotel and the buzz on the street was fantastic. It was a little noisy on Friday night but I slept through it anyway. If you are a light sleeper it could be a problem. Bathroom was clean and very well revamped. Breakfast was continental style, although there was hot food available and staff were most helpful. Book breakfast at time of booking hotel as no breakfast is worth €14 per person per day extra. Location is wonderful, a 3 - 4 minute walk of the Cathedral, and only a couple of minutes the other direction to La rambla. Place Rieal, was fantastic in the evening for meals and very good value. Take the usual percautions regarding leaving everything in the hotel safe and only carry the money you need for that day or evening. We had no problems and found there was a lot of patrols by police, on bikes, horses, scooters, and on foot. I was surprised as how safe it was after being warned by everyone of pickpocketers etc. I will return to Barcelona for sure and I will book this hotel again for my next trip. Excellent

Reviews.Title: “Hit or miss, depends on your room!”
Reviews.Author: vanadia7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 years ago. Although small the room was very modern and stylish, especially the bathroom and as the price and location were great, I decided to stay here again. The second time I got a very basic room. The shower was awful. The room was clean but next to a stair well, hence the constant noise from other guests having conversations on the stairs which meant sleepless nights. Although the location is perfect, I would try a different hotel if I was to come to Barcelona again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and services in old town Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: kevlarw
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five nights at this hotel during the Mobile World Congress, so the hotel was full. The location is close to the Rambla and the Picasso Museum. My room was quite large for a three star hotel. The bathroom was also quite comfortable and seemed to have been remodeled recently. The desk staff was quite helpful. The breakfast is held in the large restaurant in the basement. There was a nice selection of hot and cold options. Eggs, bacon, sausage, and sautéed vegetables were available. On the cold side there was cereal, fresh fruit, rolls, croissants, meats, cheeses and salad. There is WiFi only in the lobby area but not in the rooms. There is a charge to access the WiFi but it is competitive with Starbucks down the street. The rooms facing Ferrans street will get the evening party noises. Some of the rooms facing the internal ventilation shaft pick up some of the sewer gas smell.

Reviews.Title: “a good choice for staying in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Sergio V
Reviews.Content: This was the 1st 3-stars hotel in which I stayed in Europe and I have to say I was expecting less. I stayed in a single room. It was a bit small but very comfortable and clean (same with the bathroom). Breakfast was very complete and good and the hotel itself was decorated very nicely. The location was really good, it's in downtown Barcelona in "barrio Gótico", 5 minutes away by feet from the cathedral and the famous "La Rambla" street, 10 minutes away from the Cristobal Colon statue and the port. The only 2 things I didin't like about the hotel was that it was like a labyrinth. When I got out of the elevator it took me a while to find my room. The other thing was the non-existing wi-fi/internet connection. I heard that there wasn't any hotel around in the area or neighborhood with it, but still, if I wanted to get online from the hotel I had to pay 10 euros per hour, which was such a robbery, considering that there was kind of a cyber cafe 5 minutes away that costed 2 euros per hour... But everything else was very good.

Reviews.Title: “clean, efficient, friendly, good breakfast to prepare for the day but need to have a wireless network installed .”
Reviews.Author: elmcroft
Reviews.Content: Clean, efficient, friendly, good breakfast to prepare for the day but need to have a wireless network installed . Fantastic location for a short break and as you would expect a bit noisy if you have a room on the front!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: bagin1981
Reviews.Content: Just a great hotel. For three stars, I would say perfect. The location is convenient. Located in the Gothic Quarter. All the charms of Barcelona - literally in a minute. The hotel itself is clean and very nice. Rooms are small but very comfortable, bathroom is also small, but perfectly cleaned and disinfected. Good soundproofing. I am convinced that in order to gain the strength to walk in Barcelona, the Hotel Rialto - the perfect place. I took only breakfast - they were not diverse, but it was all fresh, tasty, appetizing. In general, I have a great experience, and from the city and from the hotel in particular! Well located and not pay too much.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - poor breakfast and overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Warhol40
Reviews.Content: Firstly can I say that this hotel is best located within easy access to all of Barcelonas attractions. We stayed from the 6th -9th Feb in room 108 which faced the front of the hotel and the main street. Room comfortable and clean. Breakfast - this was terrible and I would eat my arm if I was hungry. The hotel charges 15 euro for this and is not worth it. I would go down the street and eat at the various local cafes etc to which you would have a larger selection and also better quality. The bread was stale, the fruit juice out of a machine came with its own frothy top, coffee (again out of a machine) tasted off and the mikl sour. My partner and I got there just before 7 one morning and was told by an abrupt waitress that breakfast was at 7, to which she slammed the door in our face !!!. Also breakfast time appears to be when the staff also have there breakfast and can be seen standing in a row eating theirs in the kitchen!!!! - Not sure if this is a good or bad thing??? Otherwise a very pleasant stay, basic, clean, but do not go B&B waste of your money. A cafe/bakery serving bacon eggs/cakes/crepes etc - head towards Las Ramblas and it is on your left side, with a small sandwich shop (takeaway) (same company) opposite on your right side . I would recommend this hotel to others, though stay clear of the breakfast and restaurant|||||

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: amir_said7
Reviews.Content: The first thing i think about is the very good location, it's in the middle of La Rambla street, where all the fun and the shopping is there. it's very clean and safe. nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, but the noise may as well have slept on the streets”
Reviews.Author: helenmack68
Reviews.Content: Could not fault the hotel for location, in the middle of all the action, but up a side street. At the bottom of the street is the irish bars, My Bar, Temple BAr, Schillings etc. all great atmosphere and a must for the English, although have to add rather expensive., but Barcelona in all is rather expensive. The hotel room 163 which was for 3 adults, beautiful and spacious, 2 bedrooms, we decided two would sleep in the front room with the balcony and 1 would sleep in the back room!!! If it hadnt have had the back room which I hastily moved into I would have asked to move rooms, the noise was shocking you may as well have slept in the street, no double glazing the windows didnt shut properly and the noise from the courtyard was shocking. On the second night all 3 of us shared the double bed in the back room. Room 163 a definate no no!. Breakfast was ok but in the bowels of the earth and smell to match it - thank god for toast and marmalade. Had a beautiful meal in Sinathra's up the alley, sampled the tapas was gorgeous and could have ate it again and again. Each tine you walk around you find new square with more bars, if you enjoy the spanish wine then your fine but a gin and tonic on the last night set me back 11 Euro's, and 25 Euro's for 3 cocktails , you would just refuse to pay it in England! Dont get me wrong had a great trip with great friends, but to sum it up Barcelona is expensive and cant see it getting any cheaper, stay off Les Ramblers for eating and drinking, Sagrada Familia is a must and if the queues are long, they go down really quick our queue as past mcdonalds and went down in 10 minutes, also Park Qwell is a must, although it was raining when we went we stopped off the Jambon baguette and wine. mmmm - Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: treefrog40
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay in the Rialto hotel and I have to say we were very happy with the quality and service. Room clean and a good size and balcony overlooking the main street was perfect. Not much noise at nights and bang in the middle of the action. A stones throw away from bar shilling which serves great cocktails and beer and good bar food for lunch. Hotel near to the square with some amazing restaurants serving brilliant value meals. Three course meal for two with a bottle of wine for 38 euros, can't grumble at that. If you want something extra special you have to try the restaurant Pla...google it! Superb. Hotel staff were excellent and the breakfast was pretty good although it was like feeding time at the zoo sometimes but patience is a virtue and all that. Three nights bed and breakfast for two at less than £200 in the centre of a vibrant city, what on earth have the people in the previous reviews got to moan about? I suspect they would moan if the staff carried them personally to their rooms and hand fed them pealed grapes. If your'e the kind of person that expects the Hilton at Fawlty Towers prices then don't stay at the Rialto. If you appreciate hard working staff and a comfortable, clean and perfectly located hotel I'd get booking your next stay here although avoid January as we want to go back and don't want the rooms to get fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Waterbaby666
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in mid January so we could go to the Nou Camp for a Barcelona match. The hotel was in a superb location just off las rambles a close to the metro for easy transfers from the airport and to and from all the major sights. Service was a little slow on reception when we checked in, but this was mainly due to lots of other guests from other countries pushing in all the time...only the Brits queue politely! The room we got was fine, small but just what we needed. It overlooked the main street which was a bit noisy but never bothered us. The room was warm on a night and could with a bit better air con because if you left the window open it would be a bit rowdy I suppose. It will be more of a hassle in summer than the chillier winter months though. The bathroom was great with a nice hot powerful shower. The room was cleaned daily with towels changed. The only real down point for the hotel was breakfast, which was 7-1030. If you go after 9am it is chaos. Busy and hard to find a seat and people queuing like crazy to feed their caffeine addictions at the coffee machine and blocking access to everything else. The second day we went earlier and it was much easier to get what we wanted. I will say that it won't be to everyone's taste. There's no traditional English style fry-up. The hotel is obviously trying to please everyone, so cauliflower is not really my idea of a breakfast food but there you go. We managed to get cereal, nice rolls, excellent croissants and cold meats and cheese however, as well as fruit yogurts, so just a nice continental breakfast really. All in all I'd say we will return to this Hotel as it had everything we needed for a short break, was great value for money and the best you can expect from a busy city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central location”
Reviews.Author: gl321
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rialto for 3 nights in December 2011. I was worried after reading the negative reviews, but was pleasantly surprised. Our room was situated on the 5th floor, over-looking the street below. We experienced no problems with street noise (as mentioned in previous reviews). The only noise we did experience was for half an hour at about midnight on the Saturday where locals where cheering in the street - I'm guessing there was a football win. The beds were comfortable and the hotel room as expected for a hotel in Spain. The only issue with our room was the shower, which was constantly scolding and the water sprayed out through the sides of the shower head. The breakfast was nice enough and consisted of various pastries, cured meats, cereal, salad. The croissants were very good. The reception staff were very friendly and were always happy to help. The hotel itself is situated in a street off La Rambla, so very central to everything. The nearest metro station is under a 10 minute walk away and Barcelona Cathedral is a short walk away. Barri Gothic is a lovely district of the city, with narrow streets full of boutiques and patisseries and pretty squares.

Reviews.Title: “Easyjet holiday in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Seckford
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were interested in a long weekend in Barcelona, saw an advert in the Daily Mail for £299 each with Flights and Hotel. When tried to book, sold out! Guessed that they were using Easyjet to get to Barcelona, so searched the Internet, found exactly same holiday(Flights and Hotel less Tour Guide and transit from Airport) for £199 each from EasyJet Holidays. Hotel is 3 star, excellent location, you get what you pay for but not as bad as some of the other reviews make out. But you only use it as a B&B because it is Barcelona that you have come to see. I also went to see FC Barcelona play, only 8 stops on the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch!”
Reviews.Author: Podman999
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a one night pre cruise stay, sold to us by cruise1st.co.uk not a good hotel for this type of stay. All we wanted was a rest after travelling until we joined the ship. We were travelling with our 16 month old son. The cot which was provided was terrible! There was a nail sticking out into his sleeping area and the end was coming apart. I had to use a luggage strap to hold the thing together! Our shower did not drain properly and 3 hours later the tray was still full of water. Breakfast was very average at best. If you were in barcelona for a stag or hen weekend it might be ok but not for a pre cruise stay. Very noisy where it is. Bed was not comfortable either. I complained to cruise1st and they have said there is nothing they can do, I'm very dissapointed with them as we spent more than £10000 between our group for the cruise.

Reviews.Title: “3 Night Barcelona Break”
Reviews.Author: JRD02
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights(Dec 2011)) at Hotel Rialto in Barcelona and found it met all my expectations. Location was perfect as it was 1 minute walk from the Town Hall and approx 4 min from Catherdral, Shopping is all on the doorstep as are the vast number of bars and restaurants, Breakfast was the usual buffet arrangement with an excellent selection of foods including hot dishes, Staff were all very friendly and approachable.The room was well appointed with walk in shower and modern fittings and furniture and very clean.The shared transfer from the airport was arranged separately and took 35 minutes at a cost of 24 euro each way for a party of 4 adults(This was prebooked with Aerocity on the internet) The Metro was also a great way to visit all the sites and the 10 journey ticket (Euro 8.25) is good value well worth using between a number of people

Reviews.Title: “best buy”
Reviews.Author: dindan_11
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent and considering the price it is best buy. However, the dampness in the room hit you when you walk in, something that could have been easily rectified with aerosol spray and was not done. Breakfast is basic but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ladym03
Reviews.Content: Just back from a short break in Barcelona, Hotel Rialto is in a superb location, just of The Rambla, friendly staff excellent value for money, rooms are small but big enough

Reviews.Title: “Handbag snatch”
Reviews.Author: Imelda_11
Reviews.Content: My friend's handbag was taken in broad daylight from a sofa in the lobby, she was unwell. It had her passport, keys, wallet, airline ticket home, phone.The Reception staff were less than helpful and simply pointed to a notice in Spanish on the Reception desk disclaiming liability. I think that a hotel should offer a secure lobby. If they know they have a problem, (and they must, because of the notice), they should provide extra security. Sunday breakfast was a fiasco, not enough tables, or food, or cutlery, and rude unhelpful snappy staff. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Short Break in Barcelona, staying at the Rialto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PIH60
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in the heart of the Gothic area.and central for most of the historical sights.Easy access to Metro.Tip-buy 10 journey pass for Metro that way two people get five journeys.Airport bus buy return ticket.If your hotel does not offer a FREE tour around the gothic area arrange withTravelbar.com.It was excellent and this we did on our first day in the morning and it gave us a better understanding of the area and its history + you get a beer for 1 euro afterwards!Daytime was warm and we did not need coats,nightime was chilly.Barcelona is a beautiful city and if I like us you are only going for a few days I would reccommend you buy a good guide book as their is such a lot to see. See the sights during the day and shop,eat,drink and be merry at night.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what ut says it is, a city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucky97
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the end of November and found the hotel to be clean, very convenitent and most staff speak passable English. The rooms was quite small, but it was clean and tidy with an assorted of toiletary's in the bathroom. One thing missing was a kettle and cups in the room, but you couldn't really complain about anything. Breakfast is buffet style and is OK. But if you want the real taste of spain, then go to the local tappas bar and have something there, half the fun is not knowing what you are picking.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Room121 & One's Close by”
Reviews.Author: Helen K
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel earlier this month (nov.2011) and were put in room 121, it was the most horrible room we have been given by a hotel in a lifetime of travel. Very very dark and the view from the window was 3 brick walls that surrounded the window. The really frightening thing was that some phyco could walk from neighbouring windows and come into your bedroom if you left the window open, as there was concrete level with the bottom of the windows in that part of the hotel. No wonder there are attacks and worse on holiday makers. We had to sleep with the window shut tight and the heat was unbearable as the air con. didn't work, they would not change us to another room which no one could come in the window, they said booked out. The staff were most unhelpful and verging on ignorant. This so called hotel is a renovated house, it's clear from the tiny lift that holds 3 people at a time and takes ages to appear, when you arrive on a floor you are expected to haul a 20kg case up and down steps to get to your room. Can you imagine if you were quite elderly you just could not do it. The breakfast is terrible, diluted orange quash as all of the 3 juices are. You have a choice of a slice of cheese and ham or a hard boiled egg. The toast is a DIY job which caused a big que. The staff at breakfast are most unhelpful and are ignorant not verging on it. Do not go to this hotel unless you demand a room that looks out on the road were the entrance is which is a very noisey shopping area, but at least no one can walk accross a flat roof into your room via the bebroom window, better still just refuse to go to it. NEVER again will we stay in this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel + location!”
Reviews.Author: charley1990
Reviews.Content: In the PERFECT location for bars, restaurants, shops, cafes etc.. within walking distance of everything we wanted to see. Room was lovely, bathroom fantastic.. looked like it had recently been renovated! Only paid for breakfast, but had a huge range of food. Would definitely book again, absolutely loved it! thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Dark & Dingy Hotel (though in a great location !)”
Reviews.Author: Ticktoneers
Reviews.Content: You first arrive at this hotel and think, "hey, this looks nice). You then check in with grumpy reception staff who made me feel like I was a hinderance. We were given a twin room that felt like a cell. It was small, dark and cramped with one very small window that let no light in. The facilities were poor and the TV on its last legs - however it was very clean which is why I gave it 2/5 and not 1/5. The location is great for the Ramblas and restaurants, shops etc. but is a very over priced place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Prepaid reservation was not honored”
Reviews.Author: Scoot45
Reviews.Content: We prepaid for a room almost two months in advance. We arrived early in the afternoon, but were told we would have to stay at the Medinaceli. We chose the Rialto based on its location, and were disappointed with the location of the second hotel. I was reluctant to book the Rialto due to lack of courtesy of the staff on three previous visits, but they reached a new low in professionalism this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rialto”
Reviews.Author: barraib
Reviews.Content: The room was very small with no tea/coffee making facility. The air conditioning was barely adequate as it was very stuffy. The room looked out onto other bedrooms. The hotel has an excellent location right in the Centre near restaurants and transport bus/metro/taxi etc. The breakfast is good. However for me I requested Glutten free bread for breakfast as I am Ceoliac. The response from the hotel was to go to the bakery and get the bread myself for breakfast although they didn't know where it was. So each morning I went out to buy the bread and took it with me into breakfast. Normally other hotels provide this type of bread.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: JonsTravels11
Reviews.Content: great location in the center of the gothic district. room very small . window faced interior walls and other rooms, practically reach out and touch other room windows. nice continental breakfast down in a very old basement with lots of character. worth the money ,but I would ask for a better view next time.

Reviews.Title: “A great location, but lacking”
Reviews.Author: givemeone4theroad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the heart of the Gothic Quarter and ideally situation for Las Ramblas, the Cathedral and exploring this part of Barcelona. There is also a Metro stop within 5 minutes walk which makes getting to other parts of the city, and beyond, pretty easy. The first room I was given was very small, but I was able to move to a larger room which was ok, but it lacked any place to put cothes except for a tiny closet. I would also agree with comments in other reviews regarding noise levels, but hey you're in the heart of the city so you're not going ot get peace and quite. The hotel has no internet service (wired or otherwise), so be prepared to look elsewhere if you need email of web service.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: mamasmurph
Reviews.Content: you must always remember that in Europe rooms are much more compact and functional. This being said I found the Hotel Rialto to have great character and fantastic location. the only complaint I would have is that it is in no way sound proof. as a matter of fact it was awfully noisy. Especially the maid service , they started early and banged around all day. Slamming doors and banging carts into walls. The hotel locked you out of the room in the afternoon so they could clean and re-stock your room. I went back to my room at around 1pm to pit some shopping away. my key card wouldn't work so i had to go downstairs and get them to let me in. Also the elevators were very scary to ride in. I only ever took it up and used the stairs to go down. Always felt like we might not make it safely to lobby. I would however stay here again due to the fact that they kept it super clean and it is only half a block from the famous La Rambla street. Also it is half a block from Palau Guell by Gaudi. It is also 2 blocks from the famous La Bouqueria food market. Most of the staff was fantastic just some issues with language barriers. The air conditioning was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greig C
Reviews.Content: Ideal location if you looking to stay in the centre of the Gothic quarter. The hotel itself was terrible. We had to change rooms as the first room didnt even have a window. We found out later that the second room didnt have hot water (or much water pressure either). The staff were also very unhelpful given the issues we experienced. Rather go for a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Missy W
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there 2 days this past week. Great location, very close to some of the sights we wanted to see and also close (within a couple blocks) to a metro station. The room was on the small side, but we got what we paid for. The only real complaint we had was that they didn't sweep the floors at all. Everything else seemed to have at least been tidied up, but both days we were there our feet turned black just from walking across the floor once. Besides that, mostly nice reception staff, clean bathroom, and very little noise. As long as you go into it not expecting anything extravagant, you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: L4ZY_80Y
Reviews.Content: Average hotel in excellent location. The hotel itself looks really nice in the lobby area. However, the rooms are a little different. My girlfriend and i were not expecting much from, but firstly we got put in a twin room and after we called reception we were moved to a room which was half the size of the twin room and right next to the elevator. A good thing is that you do not really get too much elevator noise, but you can sometimes hear rowdy guests. My biggest problem with the room was that there was no natural light, so with the lights turned off at midday it still looks and feels like midnight. I think my body clock was quite confused the 3 nights we spent in that room. Other than that the room was quite clean and the bathroom quite respectable in size and cleanliness. One major downside at the hotel would definitely be the service. To start with housekeeping, although they do a good job with the rooms they walked in on my girlfriend and i twice in the space of 30 minutes on the day we were meant to check out... and it was still 2 hours till check out. In fairness it appears someone turned our DND sign around so the housekeeper would have thought the room was empty, but you would think after the first one walked in she would have turned the sign back around. The second lady that walked in looked like she was the angry one and took the sign off the door and was showing us... my girlfriend and i just stared at her since we were still in bed. Down at front desk service seems really slow and half willed. There is generally 1 person at front desk and quite a few guests. Someone that appeared to be of a supervisor role was always there sitting at a desk and does not appear to want to help front desk team, unless there are dire circumstances. I expected more, especially when the service we received in the restaurants in the local area and in shops were second to none. The hotel is located in an amazing area. Right around the corner from La Rambla and on a street of many restaurants and shops. My mouth watered every time i walked along the street at how amazing all the food looks in the restaurants and gelaterias. Very close was the marina and the mercado where you just need to go for breakfast! The pizza slice there are so amazing and enormous! Barcelona is an amazing city and the location of the hotel is in the more gothic part of the city meaning you have this amazing architecture at your doorstep. Would i return to the hotel? Maybe for the location, but the service really should improve.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Ideal for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Ariana80
Reviews.Content: A city centre hotel with some frills. Air conditioned rooms. Decent shower. No noise. Basic breakfast. Reception staff just OK but a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location but expect more”
Reviews.Author: Megan D
Reviews.Content: Tremendous location, couldn't be better. Check in reasonably efficient. That was the end of the good service. Rooms tired. Access with big suitcases very difficult. Felt that this property is in serious need of a major upgrade. Very basic, cost not justified. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: carla188590
Reviews.Content: We just returned form Barcelona where we stayed 3 nights at the Rialto Hotel. The hotel was very clean, good breakfast and location excellent. There were 8 of us and we booked through Alpha Rooms and our rooms were situated on the first and second floor. The front desk staff weren't particularly friendly but overal a very good hotel for the price we paid so no complaints. Will stay here again but would prefer a room with windows as all our rooms were integral and a little dark.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location , BUT...”
Reviews.Author: powers2122
Reviews.Content: excellent location, very clean open reception, arrived before 12 noon, had not expected to be checked in there and then, but friendly male at reception said there was room availabe , which was great as we were carrying 2 large cases, on arrival to our rooom {510} small but adequate for our 1 night stay,we decided to change our clothes and see some of barcelona, my wife almost removed some of the sole of her foot from a few Nails sticking up on an area raised area of flooring inside the door area, we contacted reception immediatly, spoke with male very poor english told him of the Hazzard in the room,{nails protruding} he replys, Who Did This , asked if some one could look at the problem in the room? he simply didnt understand, we said what the hell and headed out and about not far to main steeet, in the morning we showered ran the water brown debri came out of taps, water didnt exit as if blocked, sink in bathroom the same, water didnt exit, like a room that was not used in a long time, we checked out early that morning, dont think we could have stayed 1 more nite in that particular room,

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, centrally located city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ginger Bubbles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a family on a two-centre holiday with Inghams. We were given the adjacent rooms we requested which were small, as with all city hotels, but very comfortable. We were grateful for the air conditioning in the rooms and appreciated the walk-in showers (be aware - the showers aren't very powerful due to the scarcity of water). A buffet breakfast was included in our stay and we were given vouchers to hand to the head waiter in the cellar restaurant every morning. The buffet seemed to cater for all nationalities with English and continental breakfast. The hotel staff were friendly and efficient and the hotel was very clean and well-run. The only thing that marred our stay was a nearby fire door slamming shut as other guests came in late (or in the early hours!). The Rialto is in a central location and we were able to explore much of the city and new marina on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Location 50 metres from mid La Rambles - watch out for dark corriders”
Reviews.Author: Highadventurer
Reviews.Content: Not sure if this is the best value for a 3 star. However there are some pluses eg well located near Mid La Rambles and the Market and lots of restarants serving paella, fast food and trinkets. Certainly there is a good tapas bar just next door to the hotel and it is quite smart looking crowd eating here. I do not like the inner room allocated as the window opens up in an airwell (meaning no view and perhaps unncessary worry). The walk along the corridor to your room coulld be eerie after a late nite as light sensors are inoperative. Last not least there is no free internet access even at lobby. "Different srokes for different folks "- really and there are plenty of other choices of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old and poor hotel despite the good location”
Reviews.Author: Francis B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old, poor rooms, average breakfast despite the good locations, easy to walk everywhre.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: loproSydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money. The hotel is located in the Bari Gothic: the Medieval neighbourhood. The hotel is approximately 50 metres from La Rambla and 20 metres to Plaza san Jaume and the cathedral. There are also quite a number of restaurants in the street. As the street is a busy pedestrian area, we felt quite safe at all times. The rooms are quite small, but extremely clean and have very nice upgraded bathrooms. As with every hotel: not all rooms are equal. Make sure you request either a street view room (which have a balcony) or a room looking into the internal courtyard, as some just open into a smal lgrubby light-well. The breakfast is the best we had on our holiday....cereal, fruit, eggs, bacon, sausages, toast etc etc.... The staff was helpful and professional, with lots of suggestions on what to see, and had a daily weather forecast displayed. They also allow you to leave your luggage there when you check-out. .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: GugaRs
Reviews.Content: The hotel has excellent location is in the center of Barcelona, the street is not open for cars, but they can entry.The problem that we had there is that the air conditioner wasn't working and it was a very hot day.The room didn't have fridge.In the basement where they serve breakfast is amazing .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet stay.”
Reviews.Author: csb14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with my sister, her husband and two teens recently stayed at the Rialto Hotel. It was a great location a block or so off of La Ramblas. It was in a very fun part of town with many, many cute shops and restaurants. Breakfast was included. Our rooms were clean and standard size for Europe. (My sister's family booked two rooms.) The front desk staff wasn't particularly friendly so I didn't give them a 5 rating.

Reviews.Title: “CENTRAL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: habiballah
Reviews.Content: It is a three stars hotel but its location makes it very atractive to stay in ! The hotel situated in the hurt of the well known querter ' The GUTIC querter ' in barcelona . most of the atractives of barcelona are nearby or close to it espacioly the La Rambla Pramonade !!! I had book 4 nights early at march 2011 for a low price after that the price went up and up so my advise is to book every thing you would like to visit early otherwise you will pay a lot of money later !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: susieOldham
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice, and i have to say its fantastic! The Rialto is in a great location, just off the Ramblas, there are numerous irish bars within walking distance, so its the perfect hotel for a great night out!!

Reviews.Title: “We would visit this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: chelle1009 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: A very centrally based Hotel, very clean and comfortable. We stayed in room 213 first but we did ask to be moved, as the smell of the drains were very bad. We were moved straight away to room 230 which was much nicer and a bigger room with shower and bath. Breakfast has a lot of choice however the quality wasn't as good as I would have liked, i'd rather there been less choice but better quality. Very good value for money, and beds and towels were changer every day. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Great Hotel, Lovely Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: bouncerboos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days,great location right in the heart of Barcelona, walking distance to the marina las ramblas and metro station two minutes away. The hotel was clean and tidy, bathrooms were modern and trendy. Rooms were a good size. Air conditioning worked and was a god send in the heat! The safe in the rooms is 2 euros a day though! I would stay here again! Breakfast was good and had a wide selection. Staff were friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, grate location, good price”
Reviews.Author: Netty_86_5
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 4 nights in Rialto, and it was great. Tidy rooms, helpful staff, plenty breakfast. It's close to La Rambla, and Liceu metro stop, but not a noisy hotel. From there we can easy reach all sights and the beach too. The only suprise was, that we have to pay for safe deposit (that was in the room), but it's only 2€/nights. If we go again to Barcelona, we stay also this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here prior to cruise”
Reviews.Author: AmberAcklam
Reviews.Content: We were booked in here for 2 nights prior to our NCL cruise. It was raining when we arrived and were given Room 413 - it was small, had a tiny bed and had a horrible smell. I informed reception who sent someone to investigate immediate. The sprayed some air freshener at the air conditioning system vent and said it was due to the rain. It became worse later that day but they were unable to move us to another room and the hotel was full, but would relocate us the following day. The second room was much better, Room 111, it was dated but was a good size, with larger bed and had a nice arch shaped window overlooking the street. Breakfast was a bit chaotic but we survived!! Would I stay here again? Probably if the price was right and we were guaranteed a good sized room!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it for the price”
Reviews.Author: flygirl092
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights before CCL cruise! Front desk staff very helpful and friendly. Room was just fine, yes tv is not in english, but we didn't come to watch TV. Breakfast was included for the 2 nights. Location was awesome, great bakery with cookies and carmels in beautiful tins 2 blks down, make sure you try some!!!! It's not a american room size but we had lots of luggage and we fit just fine. Yes breakfast is different from american but isn't that why your in europe. Can't beat the price here. Would stay again in a minute. And I travel 4 days a week!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Stijepo1
Reviews.Content: Near La Rambla, very good breakfast. Close to many famous places in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Pre Cruise venue”
Reviews.Author: jimhutch
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this property and as reported it is an ideal spot for a quick stroll down to Las Ramblas. For a one or two night visit the hotel offers good value for money ,both times we have been allocated a room with a small balcony. We did not book B and B this time and had breakfast in a coffee shop down the road that offered a great selction of bakery items. Staff speak good English and are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “probebly will not visit again”
Reviews.Author: HRO123
Reviews.Content: Very good location. during our stay we had problem with the water system in the bath that did not fix commpletly. The TV in the room recieved only one station. we asked to repair but nothing done. Bearkfast was not worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: morewine3224
Reviews.Content: Just a few blocks from the cruise ship terminal, down a quaint narrow cobbelstone street, this hotel was a great find for someone that wanted to be in the center of the Gothic quarter. My double room was a tad small but more than adequate with a nice bath, and came with what I thought was a very good free buffet breakfast in a large, charming, cave-like basement. The English speaking front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Several metro lines were within easy, nearby walking distance. I was a little disappointed the hotel did not have free internet. However, with the location and the price paid for the room, this hotel was a gold mine.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff but not so nice rooms and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: gabriellafoto
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Rialto 2 nights some days apart. The first room was with out fresh air but nice bath. The second room was nice room but not nice bath and a door into the room next to me, so it was easy to hear everything from the people in that room. Breakfast was not worth to pay unless you like a lot of meat to eat. As a vegetarian it was not good. The staff was nice and helpful. It is located in the centre and easy to go to all the cosy areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: lenkabbb
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Rialto and enjoyed the location & the room. Nice and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TPM46
Reviews.Content: Our group of six often books an out-of-centre hotel but for this stay we opted for one close to the centre and the Ramblas. It was easy to get to using the airport coach. The hotel is tucked away in a narrow, busy street. The staff were helpful throughout our stay, and we were delighted to have an area in which to sit just off the lobby. The bedrooms were not large but they were adequate, and spotlessly clean, as was the bathroom. The breakfast room, in the basement, is huge, and provides a really excellent choice of both hot and cold food. Our timetable - we came to watch the European Athletics championships - meant that we got back late, and did not get an opportunity to try the bar, which is also in the basement - but there are plenty of eating and drinking opportunities in the surrounding area. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Rialto. The facilities and staff were excellent and the price, including breakfast, was very competitive. We would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Look for alternatives”
Reviews.Author: Edelstoff208
Reviews.Content: As noted by others, the location is the main selling point for this hotel. Easily reached using public transportation and most of the key sites are a walk away. Plenty of bars and reastaurants nearby and the harbour is about 10-15 mins on foot. First two nights were incl breakfast (not bad at all), depends upon the number of nights booked - we stayed for 4. For the price and 3* rating, we were however disappointed. First night we were given a small room (no window) although it was clean and tidy. We managed to change rooms for the remainder of our stay to one on the 5th floor overlooking the main road. Outside noise could be a problem for some, but shutting the windows helped a lot - need to, especially at night since people party til late! However, the A/C failed (throughout the whole hotel) and the staff didn't know when it would be fixed. So the room gets stuffy... so have to resort to using ear plugs and open windows. Staff are friendly and respond the best they can given the constraints - not their fault at the end of the day. The place can be fixed up with a little investment though. Street crime is prevalent and one always has to be on the lookout. We witnessed 3 simply strolling around the neighbourhood! On another trip, we'll look to stay in another, quieter area - given the quality of public transport, no real need to be fixed in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, pity about the service”
Reviews.Author: chrissie21uk
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel for one night pre-cruise but when we arrived we were told that they wee undergoing some renovations and that we had been booked into a hotel a five minute walk away. For some people this would not cause a problem but because two of our party have limited mobility and we had heavy cases it was certainly not the best start to the trip. On our return 11 days later we were told the same story but on neither occasion did we see any sign of any renovations or work taking place. They put us in a taxi to take us to another hotel a 10 - 15 minute taxi ride away. This was not suitable as we were put into an inside room with no windows only a door leading to a disused shaft and a terrible fire risk. They said they had no other rooms available and, after ringing the Rialto, we were told that they too only had inside rooms. We elected to go back to the Rialto to sort it out with them direct. Miraculously, when we returned they managed to find two rooms with windows but we had wasted over two hours of our precious time in Barcelona. The Rialto is nothing special. The hotel is big with lots of twisty corridors to get to your room. The rooms were clean and the bathroom large. The bar and breakfast areas are in the basement cellars and as it was very hot we wouldn't like to stay there during the summer. Breakfast was adequate but we won't be staying there again. The only redeeming feature of the hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: nestonlad Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid it was a super bargain stay. The hotels position is superb & easy to get to by Metro. The room was excellent, no tea/coffee facilities & the TV no English channels were the only minuses. The breakfast although a lot on offer, did not suit our taste, the bacon for instance was the undercooked variety(horrible). The hotel is close to the Placa Reial & you must go to the restaurant Quinze Nits for the menu of the day(Euro 9.50)., just join the queue to get in. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: StevieO66 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I have read the previous reviews and there is an element of truth in each. There can be a bit of a smell of drains but not too noticable. The lighting in the corridors is on sensors. However I would return to this Hotel without hesitation. Yes its 3 star and while not on Las Ramblas it is just off it and less than 5 minutes stroll from the Metro(Liceu). If you need 5 star luxury go elsewhere. If you want a comfortable clean extremely well located Hotel then Rialto might just do.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, central location, would use again.”
Reviews.Author: mazianShropshire
Reviews.Content: Room great, right near the Ramblas. Our room was newly refurbished, overlooking the main street. Not noisy at all. Breakfast catered for every nationality, cannot fault it! Beds very comfortable, shower excellent. Staff very helpful. Only complaint, TV had no english programmes at all, only Spanish and German. We would have liked to see the news in English.

Reviews.Title: “adequate central hotel, on fairly busy and noisy street.”
Reviews.Author: ioanemlyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with my son and 9 year old grand-son for 2 nights on B+B basis.We went to see Barca playing at the Nous Camp, great night. The hotel is perfectly ok for a short break in Barcelona as it is very central , only a few minutes from the Ramblas and the Cathedral on the other side. We had a fairly big room ie 3 single beds, and we were on the front of the premesis and consequently got a bit noisy late on in the night, as there are a few bars close by on the busy street. The breakfast is really continental nothing special but you wont starve.Staff not very friendly but who cares , just enjoy Barca as a city. Good bar to visit is Flahertys Irish Bar,turn left by Burger King as you go towards the harbour end of Ramblas.Good food, beer and sport tvs, reasonable prices

Reviews.Title: “This is a 2 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo33
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel but I must label it as a 2 stars hotel only. I've stayed there from 17 to 22nd of january on a business travel, it was so cold that sometimes I've tried -2Cº for the first time in my life and I didn't like it. The problem was that this hotel didn't have the heater working well in the bedroom either the shower, that had cold and hot water at the same time so, I had to workaround this problem by entering the shower only when the water gets hot. I've asked them to move me to another room, they did it but the problem was the same so I gave up. The negative thing on these hotels in Europe is that breakfast is not included so, I had to pay it separately and it wasn't that good either. No wi-fi internet access at all! There's only one kiosk with internet access that is also very expensive! For the reasons above, I classify this hotel as 2 stars only. The only good thing is the location.

Reviews.Title: “No frills - great location”
Reviews.Author: Jannie77
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights in this hotel after the apartment we had originally booked in Barcelona turned out to be a nightmare. The price was reasonable, however our room was very small with a tiny window with no view. The good thing was it was clean and had a safe that we paid €2 per day to use. On our 2nd day we had problems with the plumbing so we were moved to a bigger room which was nice, although a little cold. The location is fantastic however, we walked everywhere in Barcelona from this hotel. The staff were helpful, and we felt safe in this hotel. If you are on a budget this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location & value for money”
Reviews.Author: Scribbler33 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights on a B&B basis having booked via Octopus Travel. The location could not be better for the tourist who wants to explore the gothic quarter, La Ramblas or even the waterfront which is within easy walking distance. Hotel staff were very helpful and polite. The choice at breakfast [buffet] was very good and had a wide range of hot and cold choices. We ate in the hotel dining room one night but were the only ones there and the atmosphere was 'zero' . However there are plenty of restaurants very close to the hotel which should suit most tastes/pockets. Our room was very clean, well appointed and big enough for a short break but it was close to exterior air conditioning ducts and was very noisy at times.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Lociation”
Reviews.Author: lielowlil Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed with family at the Rialto in early December, while previous reviews have been mixed I could not fault this hotel, breakfast was fine lots to eat, we had an external room with a small balcony beds were comfortable and room was very clean and tidy, maid service was excellent with clean towels each day if required. Location was great central to everything we did a lot of walking and sightseeing Barcelona is a wonderful city. If returning to this city would most certainly go back to the Rialto

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: BaytoBay
Reviews.Content: For the price, the location was the only plus. Rooms need updated. Fuse kept blowing out with hair appliance. Our room did not have a view, looked out onto duct work that was very noisey during the rain...drip drip drip. Room had no ventilation so we kept the window open which made us share the room with loads of hungry MOSQUITOS. We had 3 nights of no sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Shelly-Tom
Reviews.Content: myself and my husband are just back from a 5 day break to Barcelona and stayed in the Rialto.We arrived late at night and did not like our room at all.We had requested a balcony room through our travel agent and had not got one.There was lots of broken wooden tiles leading into the bathroom which were a hazard as my husband slipped and I stubbed my toe.Not a very promising start but it did get better! We rang reception and explained problem with room and they said we could change rooms in the mornlng which promtply happened.Second room had balcony window which was nice to open and listen to hustle and bustle outside.Small but very comfortable room,good shower but tended to soak floor even though glass screen appeared very sturdy.The room was cleaned every day of our stay and was always spotless on return from day out which was great.The buffet style breakfast was excellent with something to suit everyone,cereal,fruit,toast,eggs,bacon,fresh fruit and juice,tea,coffe,etc.The reception staff were all pleasent and went out of their way to help with queries and problems.They even provided easy to read maps on how to get to places of interest.Lots of bars/restaurants in the area so easy to find places to have a good meal and a few drinks.If we visit this beautiful city again would stay in hotel rialto.Its only 5 min walk to the Ramblers and lots of great shops nearby.Found the people to be very friendly and charming.Our flight back to Dublin was quite late so we paid 22euro for late check out on day of departure.Allowed to keep the room up until 6pm so it was well worth it to be able to have a rest and then shower and pack at leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: omriqo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about one minute walking from La rambla, close to the famous La Boqaria market. The rooms are ok, closing the window leaves the noise outside. But here ends the PROs. The stuff service is aweful: we arrived at 4pm and our room wasn't ready, the receptaion forgot to give us breakfast tickets so we were shouted at the dinning room for arriving without them, waiting time for the elevator is approximatly 10mins, internet is overpriced, the dinning room at the basement is like a military dinning room - over crowed so you have to fight for a table and than clean it youself, stand in the line for 10mins for a hot drink and stand the inquiring looks of the stuff checking if you have taken a napkin from the restuarant. In addition the cleaning stuff seems to be working for 24 hours - whenever you arrive there are giant laundry bags and cleaning carts in the corridors. Terrible memories.

Reviews.Title: “Pros: GREAT location, nice view, helpful staff. Cons: no wifi, internet use fee is overpriced”
Reviews.Author: mthepixie
Reviews.Content: It was with very low expectations that we arrived to this charming hotel. The room offered to us was very clean, but the view was so-so and we asked to move to a room with a view. "No problem", said the lady in reception, and moved us to a external room, viewing one of the nicest streets in Barcelona. The superb hotel location allowed us to open every day during our stay in Barcelona with the atmosphere unique to the gothic quarter, not to mention the ability to tour the entire city by foot alone. The hotel itself is a bit old, the design is nice, but a bit shabby due to wear. The staff were extremely helpful, providing advice when needed. Rooms were cleaned daily, with great care. Note that the use of the internet in the hotel lobby is totaly OVER PRICED - 2 euros for 10 minutes (!) - hopefuly the hotel would alter this ludicrous taarif. For a young couple, this area was a bit to quiet at night, most bars were closed preaty early, and no good parties around, so if your looking for a more vibrant night life area, maybe better to think about Raval area (cheaper too) or Born area, which is a very pictoresque. All in all, if you're looking for a hotel in the center of the old town, but don't mind the absebce of wifi or a fridge in your room, this is most def the place to stay (just make sure you get an external room facing the street - to get the view).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at cost of no wifi and fridge!”
Reviews.Author: abc123Victoria
Reviews.Content: Comfortable bed and quiet. Room features pleasant and all functions. Lack of WIFI (other than stupid sideways screen one in lobby at 2euros for 10 or 15min). Go to MacDonalds 4 mins down street for free wifi. Extortionist rate for room safe which was free in Many other hotels!. No fridge - and at cost of beverages/food in Barcelona this was badly missed. To balance this however is the FANTASTIC location right near the famous La Rambla pedestrian mall. BEWARE PICKPOCKETS and rip off prices along La Rambla for beer / beverages! I paid 6 euro for a beer, 3.50 for lemonade which was mainly ice.. A friend paid 9euro for beer!! Everything seemed VERY expensive in this tourist mecca.

Reviews.Title: “for that price is ok”
Reviews.Author: paccacuregge
Reviews.Content: honestly speaking for the price that i paid and comparing with the other hotels the rialto is pretty good, good location near the rambla, staff is helpful , of course the hotel need renouvation and maintenance but if you will stay maximum 2 or 3 nights and you have budget is fine

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs new staff”
Reviews.Author: Ems_S28
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the hotel reception staff informed us that they could no longer accommodate us and we would need to find another hotel. Even though I had the confirmation email with me! It took 2 hours of phone calls before they agreed to let us check in. It was obvious that the hotel had double booked the rooms but they would accept no responsibility and were not prepared to help resolve the issue. The following day we attempted to use the internet and swiped a credit card to access the internet as required. The internet did not work and we had already been charged for usage. When we informed the reception staff that we had been charged for a service we had not received, we were met with 'it's not our problem'! When we continued to pursue this the male receptionist became very aggressive and started demanding our room number! This hotel is in a great location but unfortunately that is the only positive. Staff are extremely rude and unhelpful, rooms are uncomfortable and noisy. I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, Clean room, Poor shower facilities”
Reviews.Author: viv_leejensen
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Rialto has a great location, right in the heart of Barri Gotic. The room we had was clean and well furnished, and we were lucky enough to have a balcony. Breakfast is easy to get at the nearby cafés. The staff were friendly and helpful. The only problems were getting to the hotel - we tried to get there in our rented car, but it was impossible as access was blocked - and the shower. To solve getting to the hotel, we returned our rented car and took a taxi. The shower was not easy to manage. The main problem was the glass screen, that was not sufficient to prevent water from falling onto the floor and running onto the floor of the bedroom. We didn't complain as it was not something which could be fixed immediately. Otherwise, it was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location... Good price... everything nice!”
Reviews.Author: ash24helen
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this hotel. Make sure you ask for a balcony room though otherwise you feel like you are in an institution. It is cheap and just enough. I prefer the beach though, next time I will stay closer. It is still in walking distance to the beach but it is located right in the middle of the city. Great location for city life. I would recommend this one to anyone wanting to be in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, well appointed clean rooms,nice location, overall a well run hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Veekay31
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Rialto with my family in June 2010. The hotel is well located, within walking distance to the famous Rambla street and fairly close to the Metro and bus services. It has good spacious and clean rooms which are well maintained. The sevice is excellent with very courteous and helpful staff. The breakfast provides a big variety to cater to varied tastes and served well. Overall a nice experience and definitely, value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Manchesterviv
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for exploring the city. Situated just off the Ramblas in the Gothic Quarter. Our room No.306 was spacious and clean, nice bathroom, overlooking street and great for people watching from balcony. Maid service everyday with fresh towels. Hot buffet breakfast with lots of choice so something for the fussy guest! Reception staff bit hit and miss, some more friendlier than others but had no problems with them. Found some very reasonable restaurants, if you turn right out of hotel walk down and cross main road. Recommend Laverno de Cobra, delicious food. Use the public transport very clean and cheap E1.40 one way any distance on bus or underground. You can get the underground from airport and get off at the Licea Theatre stop on the ramblas just yards from Street where hotel is located. Don't pay for expensive taxis. You are warned about muggers and pickpockets although we didn't witness anything, we spoke to someone who did. They mainly went for ladies with bags around their shoulders so be careful and keep your wits about you.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: dizzy007
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a long weekend in Barcelona,we took an early morning flight from Dublin and came right out from Barcelona airport straight onto the aerobus which took us to Placa Catalunya from there across the street and the next left and your on the Ramblas,one hell of a long street.It took us a while to find the hotel ,we asked directions from a very helpful woman working in a chemist she spoke no English and us no Spanish but her directions were spot on).I have to say the first room we were given was little more than a shoe box,but my husband went to reception and asked for a bigger room,they gave us two other room keys and told us to pick the one we liked the best,we took room 268 which was lovely.The staff were very nice ,rooms made up everyday ,towels changed everyday.Breakfast was great,the coffee excellent.If your staying here make sure to visit the gothic cathedral out the hotel to the right and to the left off the square ,a beautiful building indeed.All in all a superb weekend ,I really must say the Barcelona peoples are very welcoming and hospitable,I wouldn't hestitate to recommened this hotel to my friends or indeed Barcelona itself it was wonderful....Also do try to get to see the Flamenco in the Placa Reial (left out of the hotel and the first square on the left) fabulous .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Caz121
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Rialto hotel at the end of February 2010 for 4 nights with my partner as a short break to explore Barcelona. The hotel is perfectly located to explore the city, being very close to the main Ramblas, meaning you can access many restaurants and sights easily. We were staying in a room on the fifth floor, which was fine, however the fan did not seem to work and so was sweltering hot (even though it wasn’t that hot outside) this seemed to be a problem with the other rooms in the area as they all had their windows open. Furthermore, we faced onto a back courtyard, which was not good. The room itself was small, but comfortable, with a modern bathroom (although the shower was not the best and the floor was very slippery causing a hazard) and nicely decorated. However a very large group of students moved in and were there on the last two nights of our stay, who made an unbelievable amount of noise throughout the whole night and very early in the morning. We complained several times to the hotel reception, who did not take our concerns seriously and did nothing about the noise resulting in two nights with no sleep. This was very disappointing, spoilt the trip and severely reduced our opinion of the hotel as we would expect the hotel to act on our concerns. We are a young couple who do not like to complain about noise or the condition of the hotel, however on this occasion we were shocked that the hotel staff did nothing to stop the noise leaving us feeling that they were unhelpful and not concerned with our complaint. Our experience of Barcelona itself, aside from the hotel was very good. We paid for the room only rather than breakfast and I am glad we did, with many places to eat both on the Ramblas and the street the hotel is located on (we ate breakfast at one particular place each day, which was very reasonable). We also found a small restaurant just opposite the hotel, selling pizza and a drink for around 8 euros, which was very good considering Barcelona was an expensive city to eat out. A tip for sightseeing is to use to Barcelona Tourist Buses which run from the nearby Plaza Catalunya and are an excellent way to see the sights of the city, with three different routes to choose from or you can do all of them. Overall we had a lovely break in Barcelona, however we would not stay in the same hotel again as although excellently located, there are many hotels in the Ramblas area to choose from, which are likely to offer higher levels of service looking after their customers and for a similar budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: evelyn_speak
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights while exploring Barcelona. Had a standard double room that looked out on a courtyard that hotel seemed to surround. Weather very cold during our stay but room's heating system kept us cosy. Bathroom was excellent, modern with great shower. Breakfast was a buffet - fruit, cold meat. cheese, yoghurt, cereal, bread rolls, toast, hot bacon, spicy sausage, eggs, Coffee from a machine was good enough to drink black. Staff helpful and friendly. From what we could see of other rooms as we walked past, they seemed of a similar standard. Fabulous location as could walk to most sights or get metro. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gosolo56
Reviews.Content: Just of La Rambla and near the old part of Barcelona, it is in a great location. The room wasn't the best I've ever stayed in, being very small, but the bathroom and shower were very good (even though you had to let the shower run for a good 10 minutes before it got hot), and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was good with a large selection and good value for money. I would stay here again. But a BIG warning to people, one of our party was pick pocketed one night when we were walking back, and the place is littered with tramps and winos sleeping rough, it think this is a big problem, and can't understand why there isn't a bigger police presence.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Esse64
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at this Hotel in the city center of Barcelona. The rooms were ok. Their were no wifi though. But You have to eat breakfast elsewere. It was way to greasy, the break were dry and the coffee lousy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: EastYorkshireBadlad
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room on the fourth floor with a small balcony overlooking the street which was beautiful with the xmas lights still on. The xmas ligts in Barcelona are among the best in the world and well worth a look. The hotel is only 15 mins walk to the port area and the same to plaza catalunia. All in all we could not fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DEBORAH2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from the 24-27 of December. The first room they gave us was so dirty you could see a thick layer of dust on the sofa. The smell was stuffy and unbearable. We requested a different room. The housecleaning manager came upstairs to our room, only to tell us that we were too demanding. The second room we got, overlooked the street, there was not dust cause there was no sofa; however we could not walk barefooted since the hardwood floor was extremely dirty from accumulation of residue of dirt and sticky food glued to the floor. They swipe the floor, but never wash it. The drug dealers are in your face, offering any kind of drug and the robbers wait for you in every corner. WORSE!!! the streets around the hotel are inhabited by fanatic Muslims getting to the street at 2 o'clock in the morning shouting and screaming "death to Jews and Americans" . When it gets dark, you need to be very careful and hold the wallet or the purse in the front. Since it was very cold, and everybody wore coats the danger of being robbed diminished. The police does not show presence and the people going to mass on the 24 of December felt uncomfortable walking to church, being constantly surrounded by fanatic Muslims making jokes of Christians. There are many other hotels in the area to choose, THIS ONE SHOULD BE AVOIDED.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very good breakfastwe”
Reviews.Author: Nurser
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 6 nights, the rooms were tiny and with dust, they were removing the carpet from our floor, so it wasn't pleasant. the staff not that good, but the breakfast very god. the location it's the best thing, near Rambas e Palau de la Generalitá, the city never sleeos.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff shame about the crime, grime and noise”
Reviews.Author: Bichard
Reviews.Content: We were a group of gents on a short trip and did not expect a lot from the hotel. We were not disappointed, as we did not get a lot! Positives Staff were really helpful and genuine. Central location Clean rooms and shower Downside The central core rooms over look a squalid court yard where neighbours though it great to play music in the early hours and builders used jackhammers first thing. The street outside was peppered with drug dealers and robbers. I was subjected to two attempts to trip you over and I am told the men rifle your pockets. If you are lucky, you do not get hurt. The cops patrol the street but do nothing. Do not walk outside alone after dark. The hotel claims to have air cond. It was fitted but switched off in October. The room was stuffy and smelly from the drains. Would I go again? Maybe but I would not walk back at night. Best deal The open top bus tour. Either one was a great bargain Barcelona was tremendous but very expensive in all ways.

Reviews.Title: “are you familiar with the Seeger song,"Ticky Tacky House"?”
Reviews.Author: mylanina
Reviews.Content: This is a ticky tacky hotel! No A/C...(it was 80 degrees in the room), open windows to street noise which made sleep impossible at ANY hour, a shower which overflowed out into the bedroom area, reported and ignored. Floor boards popping out from the floor, cigarette holes in the bedding, and indifferent staff. Great location, however, and we still had a helluva good time in Barcelona...just not in the hotel. AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimmie09
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location. Close to La Rambla, and walking distance to Gothic center, and great walks through the maze of narrow streets lined with shops, restaurants, tapas. Very nice breakfast at the hotel. Staff were quite helpful, arranged taxi's for us, stored our luggage. The hotel location puts you into the flavor of Spain, which is what we wanted! We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location At Affordable Price”
Reviews.Author: whysherie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Rialto in September 2009 for four nights. First room we got was really bad - wallpaper thorn, the shower leaking, twin beds instead of a double bed, one of the desk doors not working etc. We asked to change it at the reception but it was midnight and the guy simply refused to deal with it, saying they were fully booked. But they changed it (thank God!) next morning and moved our stuff. The second room was better, but it's annoying that they cannot fix small things - like smell in the bathroom or showerheads (the bathrooms are all newly renovated, they look amazing, but when you take a shower the whole bachroom will be wet, including ceiling). We did not get an "official" wi-fi connection (it worked in the first room but no in the second), but managed to find an unsecured network instead. We had room with all windows facing the well-yard, first we were disappointed but then realised it was in a way an advantage! Barcelona never sleeps, neigher will you if your windows face the main street, which is really noisy. The rooms were OK, though small, room cleaning rather regular, we did not use their safe boxes but locked up our cases instead. We did not include breakfast and had it in the streets. There was a caffe on the Placa nearby, and we enjoyed a coffe + sandwich with hamon (!) for as little as 2 euro... Do not remember the name of the place but it has a big green name sign. Location of the hotel is trully AWESOME, right in the heart of Gothic Quarter and close to everything. For its location the hotel is very reasonable priced, and for its price it looks surprisingly good. We also recommend that you go to cafe Rodrigo, just next to St Maria Del Mar cathedral. Good food, yummy, trully authentic, cooked not warmed up, cheap, and their menu changes every day (basicaly "catch of the day"). That's a real tasty home restaurant, where locals go for lunch, don't miss it. And BTW, their Sangria is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location- excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Neilnric
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for location and breakfast. It is one minute from Las Ramblas. Breakfast selevetion is excellent.
