Rooms are ok- had one over looking courtyard and one overlooking small square- you don't want rooms at the from as it is on a pedestrain street and very noisy- we were there for the September festival so glad to be at the back and you only sleep there anyway! Rooms are clean and tidy and bathrooms good. Be careful on the Metro - got pickpocketed after the fountain show- police were very helpful. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindadaly08
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this Hotel late at night when we got to our room it was a double bed as i was traveling with my mother we left the room and went down to reception and explained our case it had been my travel agent who made the mistake straight away the hotel gave us a twin room.My room was over looking a lovley court yard.The room was great,lovley big bathroom ever day our beds were mad for us.The room we had was a nice size.But if you want a safe for your room you have to pay 2€ a day.Reception were very helpfully.Would go back again to this hotel the location is great just off La Rambles..

Reviews.Title: “Location OK but not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: sebastian70
Reviews.Content: I had booked hotel and flight through Dial-a-Flight and thought I would get a good deal. i arrived at about 7pm and they gave me a tiny room on the 1st floor with small window in one corner opening into a dark and small ventilating shaft. Very depressing. When I complained they agreed to move me to another room next morning and they did. The new room on the 5th floor was small but OK. A door separated it from the next door room and I could hear everything that happened there! Signs everywhere tell you that valuables should be locked in the safe and keys for these are available at reception. Yes, but they charge €2 per day, for the privilege. Then there is the wi-fi which another reviewer has already mentioned. This category of hotel cannot afford not to have wifi, particularly since there are so many other hotels in Barcelona that do have it. The computer in the lobby wasn't working either half of the time I was there! I have friends in Barcelona and they wanted to leave a message for me: the receptionist twice refused to take a message; the third time my friends made such a fuss that finally they agreed to leave a message under my door; and they did. Lesson: complain and make a fuss if you don't get what you want. Finally there is a funny smell in the lobby! Yes the location is good and the breakfast OK (if you have it included in your rate as ortherwise they charge €14). But they need to improve what they offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: RedIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Rialto after recommendations from friends who had been there before. It's in a great location, literally 2 minutes walk from Las Ramblas and the nearest metro station. We got lucky and got a suite when we checked in so we had a separate sitting room to our bedroom which was great. Staff were extremely helpful with any queries we had. I would definitely recommend it to a couple who wants a great weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, clean and very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: crazyclaire13
Reviews.Content: I have very recently, this week , come back from staying at The Rialto, it is definatly worth every penny, it is a hotel used by Thomas Cook, it is in thier brochure, but I book it through hotels.com and got a twin room for £52 per night. The location couldn't have been better, literally 2 minutes walk from La Rambla's and easy to find when getting of the metro. Take the Aerobus from outside the airport (A1) it is about 4 euros, get off at Placa de Catalunya, the last stop, then get the metro to Liceu, one stop, you end up on La Rambla, when leaving the metro, turn and go back down La Rambla until you get to Mc Donald's and KFC on corner, go up that street and the Rialto is at the top on the right. The staff are friendly and helpful, rooms very clean, basic but value for money. We had a room facing the back, had no view but was very quiet! There is a cafe directly across the street, where you can eat the best pizza ever with pasta/salad and a drink for £8 euros which is really reasonable, as it is expensive to eat out, the staff there are very nice too! A visit to the fruit and veg market just off La Ramblas should not be missed for the best smoothies I have ever had, for 1 euro, we had two a day, absolutely delish! My 3 night stay with my 13 year old son was brilliant, would go again and stay at the hotel. A trip to Nou Camp cannot be missed! Hope this helps those trying find a basic, clean and friendly hotel. My son suggested that maybe more English channels on the TV, kids!!

Reviews.Title: “Room OK, breakfasts good, advertised wifi a joke.”
Reviews.Author: nameinamillion
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights recently and on the whole pretty happy. The room was fine (although there was a bit of a smell of drains a couple of mornings) and the all-you-can-eat buffet breakfasts were surprisingly good - a lot more variety and substance than just the rolls and cereal that pass for a 'continental' breakfast in many hotels. However, the fact that the hotel advertises it has Wi-fi access is a complete joke! There is hotspot somewhere OUTSIDE the lobby run by the local phone company Telefonica, which gives a strong signal in the downstairs lounge, but neither I nor anybody in my party could get it to work! Given that this THREE STAR hotel ADVERTISES that wi-fi available this is really very shabby indeed! I spoke to the receptionist and he just shrugged his shoulders and said it usually works! As the hotel clearly has a cable or ADSL internet connection (there is a crappy 2-euro per 10 minutes internet "console" in the lounge) they could easily provide a proper, self-managed wi-fi hotspot in the lounge and lobby area for the cost of a $50 wireless access point and 10 minutes to hook it up to their router - but apparently this is either too much trouble or they are trying to force people to use the crappy "console" instead.... Very, very shabby - and considering that there is an excellent bar just down the street with unlimited, fast, free wi-fi for the cost of a beer, this really reflects very poorly indeed on the attitude of the hotel management. So if you want a good breakfast and aren't in need of wi-fi access in the hotel then by all means stay at the Rialto. If you want wi-fi though, I'm sure there are other hotels which have made the effort and I would seriously recommend you consider them first.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Liz0042
Reviews.Content: Highly Recommended. Stayed only one night but it was clean and comfortable, in fact a very nice and modern decor as opposed to cheap and grotty. Easy to find walking distance down Las Ramblas from the main train station on Placa Catalunya. (Followed advice from this site, walk down Las Ramblas and take a left at KFC - Thanks)

Reviews.Title: “Alright stay”
Reviews.Author: KK10
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this hotel in late April good location, rooms were a bit on the smallish stay, put we got a good price for the rooms with B&B. Breakfast at the hotel was ok. Handy for the las ramblas & the gothic quarter, Champagne & Oyster bar next door worth a visit. Be careful if your staying out late our Party of men, seemed to get acosted by this bunch of african women peddaling their wears, uncomfortable and not very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: Kastro2009
Reviews.Content: Hi, i first arived and 6AM and it was very quite, we get the room in 11AM and the room was small but clean and new. we take room with baclony but you have to know that it's noise. there is no MINIBAR in the room. no WIFI and if you want wifi you have to go down to the looby and it cost 14 EURO per day. the cleaning staff was good and the room was clean every day (we spend 7 days) the best thing about this hotel is the perfect loaction, it's near the ramblas 2 min wallks and overall we like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and decent hotel room for city trip”
Reviews.Author: clare_skelto
Reviews.Content: Overall I was pleased with hotel rialto. the location was really good, just off la rambla. we tried to steer clear off la rambla for dining out in the evening because it's very geared towards tourists so we tried to walk the opposite direction from there and look for restaurants in side streets. there is a square very close to the hotel with a big fountain in the middle... cant remember the name.. that was really nice. there was a cool jazz bar there, think it was called Jamboree. some nice restaurants near the hotel, we went to some quite expensive ones. The hotel was quite small but fine. the staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful and had things like maps and leaflets about local attractions. a guy at the desk helped up find something on the map that we were looking for. There was a lift in the hotel tht made it handier and quicker to get upstairs. there seemed to b some sort of refurbishment going on in the hallways when we wer there, just not proper carpet down and stuff and bare walls i think in some places but this didnt affect our stay in any way. our room was fine, though pretty small but fine for as us a couple. the bathroom was nice and spacious and the shower was good and powerful. the bathroom suite was really modern. the bed was really comfy with white duvet covers and sheets etc. TV channels werent great just bbc news i think and maybe CNN and then just spanish channels... though we didnt care, we were in barcelona!! much better things to do than watch tv! One bad thing was that there was a really crap view out of our bedroom window. it was just like walls, as we were right in the middle of the hotel. that was probably the only downside. also because of this the room was quite dark. although since we were in a city we were doing lots and not spending very much time in the bedroom. i think if i was on a sun or beach holiday i would prefer a more spacious bedroom with a better view out the window. This hotel is good value for what you get in a good location. metro stations really close by and easy to get around. Oh and also we didn't eat in the hotel restaurant so we don't know what it's like... I saw a menu though and it said the special was roasted elbow! which i thought was random..! so we steered clear. Overall good though, i'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good base for your stay.”
Reviews.Author: KagsLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Went for 2 night mid week, Rialto perfect for what we needed but would not stay for a full week as the rooms are a little too basic on that level. The beds are very comfortable and the bathroom was nice.Consage were really helpful. We got the blue bus from the airport to Placa de Catalunya (center square) for 4.25Euro pp. (20-30 Euro by taxi). Get off the bus and walk down La Ramblas on left side, go up the road with a Kfc and MacDonalds on the corner. This is Carrer Ferran, Rialto is really easy to find if you follow this. Placa Real Reaturant was lovely, qued for 40 mins-worth it. BEWARE drank at Ambos Mundos in square, we had a sangria and a pint San.M 12.73Euro. SAY NO MORE. 3 course lunch at a little restarant off sqr back to C.Ferran on left (it is all white inside)10Euro pp and well worth it. Use the tour buses (Placa de Catalunya) for sight seeing 21E 1day, 27E for two, can hop on and off and swop 3 routes. Hope I've helped, enjoy this FAB city.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: nineandahalffingers
Reviews.Content: I had seen some good and some bad reviews of this hotel. My wife and I found the staff friendly, efficient and helpful. The room was simple, quiet and clean. Breakfast was a sufficiently varied buffet although the the fried breakfast was not great. For a European major city and central hotel this was excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Simply...the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Orsolya
Reviews.Content: I*ve just spent a great weekend at Rialto, and it was pretty good! The room was clean, my favourite was the bathroom, it's really beautiful, congrats! The location is perfect!!! Thanks, Orsolya

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: S10UXK
Reviews.Content: I travelled in November 08 with my young son and stayed in this hotel for 2 days. Must say that the rooms were cleam and would definitely recommend it for the fab location...minutes from las ramblas and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: BelfastCinders
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a 2 minute walk to Las Ramblas, variety of shops, restaurants, bars on Carrer de Farren. Closest metro is Juame 1, around 50 meters away. Room was basic but spotless, smelt a bit of varnish when we first arrived but got used to it. Was disappointed that there was no mini bar or hairdryer. Didnt go to bar or restaurant so can't comment on this. Overall would definately recommend hotel due to location.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised-great location”
Reviews.Author: coppicewanderers
Reviews.Content: We booked the Rialto because it was cheaper than any of the other hotels in the Ramblas. But we were a bit worried about staying here because the 2008 reviews of the Rialto were not good! However we were very pleasantly surprised and had a great 3 days here. Our 4 rooms were all clean and nicely decorated, with good bathrooms. One room smelt horrible but the receptionists moved us immediately to a nicer room. We later discovered that a lot of Barcelona suffers from the same drain smell. It is obvious that there are a lot of renovations going on in the hotel and that the hotel is improving week by week. Breakfast was ok (though you could have strange combinations of leftover pork chops with warmed up cauliflower to go with your croissants and rolls if you so wished). The only criticism we would have is the strange lighting in the long corridors that is movement activated. You found yourself walking in the dark and having to jump up and down to activate the next set of lights. Bit unnerving at times for a female traveller. All in all - good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “w-o-n-d-e-r-f-u-l-l”
Reviews.Author: r_poly
Reviews.Content: location-couldn't be better staff-couldn't be nicer room- perfect for avarage traveler clean, nice decorated

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: pumps100
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via a travel agent having done no prior research. We then looked on Trip Advisor and were quite worried about the hotel. We stayed for 3 nights (9th to 12th December 2008) and paid 213 euros including breakfast for two of us. We thought it was good value for money. We stayed in room 333 on the third floor. This is one of the floors that has been refurbished and was absolutely fine. They are still working on other floors and if you choose to lie in or nap in the afternoon you will hear noise - but it did not effect us as we were out most of the day. The location is really great and in my opinion could not be better. Be careful outside as pick pockets are rife as you walk down the small street from the hotel to the Rambla. I guy tried to do me - asked for the time from the wrong side of me - leaning in - I told him to [-] off rather loudly and he scarpered. We did get ripped off though in one of the Irish bars in the street - a pint and a half of Stella - a staggering 9.25 euros! Good restaurant we used was La Fonda - lovely place and 8.5 euro for the menu del dia including wine.

Reviews.Title: “disapointing”
Reviews.Author: BristolDavo
Reviews.Content: We have just reurned from the hotel rialto from a 4 day break, when we arrived only room available was small box at the top of the hotel without windows. We complained to manager who moved us to a very slightly bigger room with a window unfortunately air con was stuck on high so they pulled the fuses as this was the only way to switch it off. Every morning around 8:30 am building work started on the roof for a couple of hours, drills and hammering. Rooms were never cleaned, they only made beds. Mini bar had been taken out and no tea/coffe making facilities. Not what we booked, we were very dissapionted.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected - great location”
Reviews.Author: KCS
Reviews.Content: I had seen some bad reviews after I had made the reservation and yes the hotel is still a bit of a building site as it is going through renovations but it was not as bad as I was expecting. The rooms are cosy for sure but ît is a good location and a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: hippo69
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Hotel Rialto. We were quite worried from reading the reviews as we had already booked the city break, but it was fine. It has a great situation right in the heart of the city, i was surprised that we heard nothing from the room. We had a redecorated room which was nice but would have been better if we had a fridge and tea/coffee making facilities. The building work is still going on but only during the day they didn't interrupt or ruin our stay at all. This would be great for anyone would wants a stop over for exploring the city, don't expect luxury. We would stay there again if we go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Brightontravels
Reviews.Content: Thank Christ we only had to stay in this dump before we moved on. Booked in Haste from Expedia, Needed somewhere cheap for a night before we moved onto the Regencia (see review) The hotel from the outside looks good and it is in a prime location! However as soon as you approach the lifts you know something is wrong. We stayed on the second floor and upon exiting the lift it looked like a 1950's Squat. The first room we were given smelt of Human faeces and was dark, damp and AWFUL. We went straight down to reception to complain and we were moved to a marginally better room. The room we stayed in overlooked Calle Ferran. The room was still dark and smelt of damp. The bathroom was awful in very bad repair, stains everywhere. We made our comments noted to the manager upon check out the next morning and were told that they have a certain section alocated to Internet bookings!!!! We could not believe this....So implying that if you book the direct you get a better room!! I would never recommend staying here unless it was the only room left in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Room Could Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: KeithJeff
Reviews.Content: Great staff and wonderful location. Only complaint was that the room was the size of a closet. Apparently, most of the rooms in the hotel had been renovated...ours was not.

Reviews.Title: “Hate the Rialto”
Reviews.Author: rockstarPortLouis
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the rialto hotel for 2 nights as from the 12th June up to 14th June, before our cruise. Thought this hotel is in the heart of the Gothic quarter, next to the Town Hall and to all the shop. We are in a surprise when we went to our room. The carpet in the corridor look wears out. Also the corridor was poorly lit. When we open the window three walls face us back. The next day when we came back to the hotel after a whole day out sightseeing, the room was not yet clean. The entire dirty towel was still in the bathroom and the bed was still the same as we left the room. We complaint to the reception but that was not easy as they do not speak English well. We had to ask for clean towel and soap. It was such a disappointment. I will not recommend this hotel to any of my friend.

Reviews.Title: “Rialto love hate”
Reviews.Author: vivanl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Rialto for one night on June 11, before our cruise. The situation of this hotel is great, on a picturesque small street with antique wrought street lamps and old buildings. The lobby is bright and nice and looked very much like a small 3* hotel. However, when we went to our room the #200 on the 2nd floor it was like entering a slump house in the middle of demolition. We had to take a long detour in small hallways to reach that small and dark room which smelled moldy, had the ceiling cracked and stained by water leaking problem, the floor creaking... There was a tiny, very dirty balcony with a big hole in the ceiling and looking down to a shaft that is so dirty and glum that it's scary to stay there. We've asked to change and we didn't have to insist, the reception gave us right away, the # 216 which was better though it did not worth the 184$ we paid for the night. That room has 2 single beds, is bigger, the floor is entirely scratched, no balcony, only with a window looking out to the other wing of the hotel which is in the process of renovation so at 8:00 AM we could no longer sleep with all the noises of walls demolition. The good points are: the bathroom is nice with plenty of hot water. The beds mattresses are firmed and bed sheets are crisp and clean. We had a good night sleep, no noise (until 8:00AM). The hotel is situated in a nice street that in the mid-morning it became a promenade ( forbidden to cars), 3 minutes walking to Las Ramblas and 2 minutes to the Cathedral.

Reviews.Title: “May 2008 - mid week break”
Reviews.Author: KentJam
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night mid week break to Barcelona staying at the Rialto. The position of the hotel could not have been better only two minutes from Las Ramblas. We took the train from the airport, very convenient and cheap and then the Metro to the hotel, again very straight forward. The hotel is undergoing some refurbishment - mostly the corridors, this didn't intrude on our stay. Our room had recently been upgraded - good bathroom with walk in shower. Whilst the hotel is in the centre of Barcelona we didn't hear much noise from outside - good double glazing and air conditioning so didn't have to open windows. I would liked to have had coffee making facilities in our room - not sure if this is standard practice in Spain. We booked on a room only basis and did not eat in the hotel - breakfast 14 euros seemed expensive compared to the cheap cafes in the surrounding streets. We would definitely recommend the Rialto and would return when we next visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Donvasterfamily
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at Rialto Hotel during very busy May Day holiday weekend. Comfortable quiet hotel in a suberb location just off Las Ramblas close to the Cathedral. Our room was a good size, clean and comfortable with 3 full size single beds and well appointed bathroom (great shower & lots of hot water). Metro stops Liceu & Jaume both close by and hotel also within easy walking distance to harbour/beach area. Buffet breakfast in pleasant basement restaurant had plenty of choices with both hot and cold dishes available. The city was very busy and crowds and queues everywhere. Bars and restaurants away from Las Ramblas are much cheaper and can be less crowded. T10 ticket on metro is great value (7.20 euros for 10 rides) and can be shared. A1 Airport bus goes to and from Placa Catalunya and is much cheaper than taxis at 4.05 euros per person - takes approx 20-30 mins. Hop on - hop off City Tour buses are a must for first time visitors but be prepared to queue!

Reviews.Title: “It is a good hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: ariasias
Reviews.Content: i have traveled in July 2007 to this hotel.i stayed there 3 nights and had no problem with anything at all.In the time that i traveled there were constructions going in the hotel but had little effect on me (except some noises).My room was on the street side (which could be a plus or negative thing depending on your preference) and we could see many people passing by and the street below.At night however it was little noisy.I only used the room for sleeping at night and stayed out of hotel during the day.i did not use the hotel restaurant(there is a little Shawarma place right across the street with great food and low prices.)Every thing was working in my room and the room was clean.so if you are not a super-picky person this hotel is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindabook
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Rialto Hotel in March of this year. We had a very nice stay. It was clean. Beds were comfortable. The location was great. We walked right down the street to the La Rambles district and were within walking distance to many other things to see. We took a cab to see Gaudi's Sagrada Familia Church, it was fabulous. It is a must see. The city is very crowded but it is nice to walk around, We read were it is unsafe to walk around with belongings, never had a problem. The city was having some kind of car rally while we were there, they blocked off the street in front of the hotel, we were worriied about getting to our ship in time, but it was over in plenty of time and we got to watch the whole thing from our balcony. I would stay there again. Breakfast was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiReview
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the morning at the same time as another American couple who were unhappy because their travel agent had told them this was a "four-star" hotel. Make no mistake, the rooms are smaller than any Motel 6 that I know of and there is no one to greet you and porter your luggage. Instead, this is a clean budget hotel in an excellent location. The night clerk was friendly and helpful; the day clerk less friendly but able to meet our needs. We obtained a room long before check-in time. It was a tiny room with a nice modern bathroom and impressive shower. The bathroom smelled strongly of sewage and the courtyard outside our window was noisy. We should have asked for another room, but we were too tired. The included breakfast was far superior to any "European Breakfast" in the U.S. Bring ear plugs and be prepared for the smell, or be prepared to ask for a new room. If you do so, and understand that your budget room will be small, then I think you'll fing this hotel is a bargain given its wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: villalass
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent location, the rooms were spotless, however as we were in a refurbed room!!!! there was no mini-bar and the vending machines were expensive €2 for small bottle of water. You have to pay for the use of the safe in your room €2 per day. There were no Tea/coffee making facilities in room which i expect to be standard. The breakfast was ok. DO NOT book a taxi from hotel as they do not inform you that the Taxis charge extra for telephone bookings, it cost us €25 FROM the airport to Hotel and €36 from the hotel TO the Airport. The hotel was very quiet considering it was located on a busy street and a few bars down the road. At the end of the day you pay for what you get

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deepthinker22
Reviews.Content: We had booked into another hotel within the group which then due to a water problem could not accommodate us so we ended up at the Rialto. I am so pleased that we did! The reception staff were extremely helpful. They explained that the rooms we had been booked into were due for renovation but they were absolutely fine and spotlessly clean. The reception staff seemed able to answer any questions we had about Barcelona and were happy to arrange a taxi for us at the end of our stay. Breakfast was super - with a whole range from cereal to cooked to continental to fruit with tea, coffee juices and water available. The only noise we heard was on one night when the dustbin men collected from the rear of the hotel - the rest of the time it was peaceful enough for us despite it's central location. We stayed four nights in all. As for it's location - it really is extremely close to the Placa Reial and Las Ramblas. The Gothic area is just five mins walk the other way. The nearest stop for the Tourist Bus is probably about 10 minutes walk away and the hotel is between two metro stops so access to anywhere in the city is possible. All in all we would definitely stay there again and in fact it was actually the second stay at the hotel for the friends we were travelling with.

Reviews.Title: “only good location. will never stay in this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: travelinbarcelona
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Barcelona and stayed 4 nights in the hotel. Right after checked-in and moved the baggage in the room, I had told myself that I will never stay in this hotel again. The lift is always not working. During the 4 days, we have to walked from 3th-floor to the lobby. On the last day to check out, the lift is still not working, we have to walk the stair and take the heavy baggage to the lobby. The canteen for breakfast is in the sub-ground with very weired smell. The rooms need considerable decoration. No cup for drinking. The lime is dropping. The door in bath room can not well closed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: homerjuk
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels I've ever had the misfortune to stay in. Air-conditioning didn't work, there was no carpet in the corridors, the beds were small and uncomfortable, the lifts screeched every time we got in them, the card for the room stopped working 3 times with no explanation, there was no fridge, the window opened out into a grotty center courtyard, the staff were less than helpful and the place just seemed very run down. Also the street it's on is very unsafe at night, there were 6 of us staying here and all of us were approached/solicited, most of us followed at least once and in one case mugged during our 5 night stay. AVOID.

Reviews.Title: “Waht you see is not always what you get”
Reviews.Author: Dec105
Reviews.Content: The Rialto Hotel is the perfect location to explore the old town of Barcelona, but be careful when booking - what you see is not necessarily what you get. We booked a triple room for a mid Christmas break, and the overall impression given of the hotel on their website was that of a modern, clean and somewhat upmarket hotel. This image was also reflected in the price, which was not cheap (though hotels in Barcelona are generally quite expensive). For added value and a bit of history, we are advised that the hotel was the birthplace of the famous artist Joan Miro. The hotel lobby is bright and spacious, the staff are friendly and courteous and the lifts are modern (though a bit shaky). Unfortunately, the room we were given (361) was a disaster. If this was Jaon Miro's house, then surely this was Mrs Miro's broom cupboard. It was dark, poky, tatty and about as welcoming as a monk's cell. Instant complaint to the front desk yielded a better result - room 318, at the front of the house, which was bright and spacy and even had a small balcony overlooking the pedestrian street. Here we spent three pleasant nights with no further complaints. Breakfast was quite decent and the hotel restauarant also looked reasonable, though we didn't eat there. Internet access was also available in the lobby. Overall, the Rilato is a work in progress. A lot of the interior, especially the corridors, have a run down look, though refurbishment work appears to be going on. The location is superb - close to the Ramblas, metro, the old town, the Picasso Museum, shopping, and all the bars in restuarants in the area. But be careful - avoid room 361, and anything adjacent to it.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the rialto”
Reviews.Author: chilipepper24
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a 4 night stay at the rialto, and i can't really complain about anything. We were in a recently renovated room,which was very clean. The breakfast was nice, with loads of choice, even our fussy 2 year old found something to eat. The room was quite small, but what do you expect, plus with the amount of time you spend in your room, you don't really need a massive amount of space. The rialto is in the perfect location for sightseeing, and shops!! All in all we had a good stay, and if we ever went back to Barcelona, we would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience, great location”
Reviews.Author: RJEK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Rialto on a Saturday late October for 2 nights, a double (twin beds pushed together) on 6th floor. Arrived early morning and staff were happy to store our luggage until our room was ready around 2pm, and also gave us breakfast vouchers for that day which was nice. There are two small lifts in the main lobby with a third which only goes to 5th floor. One lift was out of action by Saturday afternoon, the second died on Sunday morning and apparently service was not available until Monday. It was virtually impossible to get the remaining lift to respond. Our room was clean but very small. The air conditioning was very noisy so we didn't use it, and there was a distinct odour of drains in the bathroom (which had been renovated - it looked great but didn't smell too good). No refrigerator either. The staff after a good start were not particularly helpful. Overall our experience at the Rialto was disappointing but it is in a great position in the old town area.

Reviews.Title: “The nightmare-hotel”
Reviews.Author: jada29
Reviews.Content: We came to hotel Rialto an evening in may for a longweekend. The room was small and shabby, but we just unpacked and left our suitcases open at the small bed (120 cm for two persons...). Big mistake. Huge. Cause when we came back after dinner four hours later the sprinkler above the bed was full on and our room totaly soaked and wet. All our clothes, our laptop and cellphone - wet and out of function. So we called the reception and told them what happened. Their answer? "Sorry but we can´t help you now." The sprinkler was still on and the room looked like a bathroom. At least we got another room - but it STANK of mould. So we asked the frontdesk if they had another room were we didn´t got mould poisoning, so they removed us to a little cubby-hole. Next morning we asked to see the hotel manager to discuss the damage at our luggage, but the frontdesk was extremely uninterested and just ignored us. The last day we finally got to see the management staff and filled in insurance papers and discussed the accident. They promised to compensate us within the next month. But we never heard from them so I called the hotel manager after three months - and he just hunged up on me, twice. This was the worst hotel we ever had stayed in, of many reasons: the disagreeable reception, the lying management, the filthy rooms with the stank of mould and the present renovations that made a constant noice. The location is however great, but that´s the only positive thing we can mention about this place. We will definitely return to lovely Barcelona, but never ever to hotel Rialto - a park bench seem to be a more attractive alternative rather than that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: APinkLady
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, our room was old fashioned and dated but ok for the amount of time you are in it on a city break. The only down side was that our room had a frosted window which made it dark and it did not open. But our friends had a lovely room with opening french doors! Looks like they are gradually doing the hotel up as the reception was very modern. Breakfast was good and plenty of it. Bar was ok, again a little old fashioned. The main feature of this hotel is its location, just a short stroll from La Ramblas, this made it very easy to get around as also only a couple of minutes from underground and buses. Pleanty of places to eat within a few yards of hotel door! Overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 3 star - great location!”
Reviews.Author: angiebabe67
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 2 night break staying at the Rialto and found it to be a perfectly acceptable 3 star hotel. We arrived about 10.30 in the morning, so obviously our room wasn't ready for check-in, but the helpful man on reception said it was ok to leave our luggage behind the reception desk until our room was ready. we returned at 12.30 and went to our allocated room - i have to say first impressions of the lift and corridor weren't great, but as previously metioned the hotel seems to be undergoing some refurbishment, so I can allow for that. The 1st room we were given had water dripping from the ceiling, quite substantionally as there was a puddle on the floor. We rang reception and were immediatley allocated another room, at the front of hotel as we had requested, and found this to be perfectly adequate. It was clean and functional, the bathroom was spotless too - i would guess this room had been one of the refurbed area's (518). The view was just fab, and the lovely hustle and bustle from the street below really helped to make our stay - i guess some people wouldn't like the noise, but we loved it. Breakfast was fine, pretty much every taste catered for - no complaints there. Room cleaned every day, fresh towels and bedding, and reception staff friendly and courteous. The location definatley gets 10/10 - try the Oyster Bar next door for early evening tapas and lovely cold white wine! Avoid Schilling Bar - over priced and horrible surly barstaff, not to mention making you wait ages and ages to pay! Should have walked out, not waited! Check-out time was before 12, which is later than a lot of places and once again, we were able to leave our luggage in reception. Overall - this is a clean reasonably priced hotel in a superb location - we were hardly in our room anyway - would definately recommend. Shop around for best rates, we booked through ryanair and got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Closedphobic”
Reviews.Author: pokotako
Reviews.Content: The room was shabby, dark, no ventilation in bathroom, tiny window to the dirty narrow courtyard in the bedroom. We got closedphobic. Phone wasn't connected (complained but never replaced), fridge was locked up. When I asked for hair dryer, was told to pay 15 euros deposit! It was too expensive 220 euros per night and this state of the room + service. We asked manager to change the room, but they were not friendly, exchanged only 1 room out of our 2 rooms to the slightly better room with full of chemical smell which gave us headache. Also Lighting was not consistent, we had light suddenly shut at night and very inconvinient till we found the breaker. We did not like the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before and have to say that the new refurbished rooms are so much better. The room was clean and comfortable and the bathroom was nice however the shower wasn't very powerful. It also had trouble maintaining a constant temperature. The location is great, right in the middle of everything, and the staff were very helpful. My only issue was that we had a room on the 5th floor quite near the vending machine and for some reason everyone decided to use it on their way back from a night out! It can get quite tiresome being woken up at 2.00am (and 2.30am, and 3.00am.....). I think that you get what you pay for with this place, a reasonable hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: nikkih7
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was having major refubishments which it needs. Room was basic. Bed comfortable. Bathroom fresh and clean but shower cubicle tiny. Breakfast was better than the usual coffee and cold croissant. Staff were not overly friendly, but that's Barcelona, right? I would recommend it on it's cleanliness and it's great location to the main street Las Ramblas. Definately recommend the hop on,hop off bus tours around Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room”
Reviews.Author: DamoEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: The location is very good but thats about that. Arriving we thought that it looked nice from outside and even from reception area but once we got to our room, we couldn`t believe our eyes. We had a very small room that didn`t even have a window in it, coupled with the fact that there was a dripping toilet and you could hear the slightest noise outside the room then we were far from happy considering the price they charged. Breakfast was acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy!”
Reviews.Author: Kerzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in June 2007. Hotel undergoing renovations but really!! Hand rails on the stairs were loose, flooring in the hotel room broken, room generally dark and safety deposit box broken. Great location but to be honest I wouldn't recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: grayz4
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great location in barca then this is for you .No frills but very clean hotel and friendly staff.Some rooms having renovations done at the moment but not a problem . Breakfast offers great choice . Would certainly recommend this place .

Reviews.Title: “nothing to complain about!”
Reviews.Author: london7254
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to its superb location, once I arrived, contrary to some of the bad reviews I have read, I really liked the hotel. The rooms were clean and average size for a city hotel, and the breakfast was fine (much better than what i have experienced at some 4 and 5 star hotels in barcelona!) Everyone should stop complaining - what do they expect for the price they are paying! If you want jacuzzi baths and private butlers, stay at the Arts hotel by the beach, if you want to be in the centre and within a few minutes of all the good places, stay at the Rialto!

Reviews.Title: “The Riatlot is improving!”
Reviews.Author: Bugs
Reviews.Content: The Rialto is in a great location, you can walk everywhere in central Barcelona from the Hotel. The hotel is in the process of being refurbished, so there is some noise in the mornings from the building work. But all the rooms I saw have brand new doors, the rooms were clean, the room I was in had been freshly painted, it was a decent sized twin room, with a hall way and a bathroom, the towels were a bit thin, but the sheets were crisp and white. A number of people have complained that the rooms were dark, this is going to be true of many hotel rooms in cities in Spain, as many are built around very small internal courtyards, and this hotel is on a narrow street so many of the rooms are going to be dark. At €89 a night for a twin room I would recommend this hotel, it is clean and in an absolutely brilliant location. Oh and the breakfast is OK too!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: WanderersCheshire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rialto Hotel at the end of March with a group of friends. I didn't book the hotel myself and didn't actually ask where we were staying until the day before. When told I did a quick search on TripAdvisor and wasn't too impressed with the comments on there. As I was only staying for one night, I decided not to worry about it and concentrate on enjoying the rest of the visit. On arrival at the hotel, the staff were very nice, unlike the predictions on TripAdvisor. From then on the hotel was much better than anticipated. I had a single room which was very small, but perfectly adequate, with everything I needed. It was at the back of the hotel, so had no view and was a bit on the dark side, but at least that meant it was quiet and I wasn't going to spend much time there anyway. The room and bathroom were clean and the towels were better than your average hotel towels. The bed was comfortable, there was plenty of hot water and an extra pillow and blanket in the cupboard. Breakfast was fine if you avoided the cooked offerings and there was a good selection of food. This hotel is in a good central location. If you're looking for a budget hotel that's good value for money, this is great for a couple of nights's stay. I would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jen23-83
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here for 4 nights in Mid March. Normally when I go for a city break I am not too fussed about the hotel, as long as it is clean and in a good location. This hotel was both clean and in an excellent location, but these are the only 2 good things I can say about it!! Our room was tiny, the bathroom door wouldn't close, and there were no tea/ coffee making facilities or hairdryer in the room as is advertised. That's just for starters! When we walked into the room first we thought the curtains must be closed as the room was so dark ... this was not the case! There was a balcony leading off the room overlooking an alleyway, hence the lack of light. So anytime we were in the room, day or night, we had to have the lights on. We came back to the room one afternoon to drop off some shopping and went to turn on the light only to discover that the electricity had gone in the room!!! As well as this, the hotel was being refurbished so we were woken up at 7 30 every morning to banging and drilling from below us. (This may suit some people, but we are a young couple who wanted to sample the night life of the city and be able to sleep it off the next morning!) So much for "soundproof rooms"!! We went to the hotel bar one night and were told at 10 30 that they had finished serving! (Luckily there are a couple of good irish bars down the road!) We found the staff to be generally rude and unhelpful and I would advise anyone thinking of booking this hotel to steer well clear!! As I said, I wouldn't have high expectations of buget hotels when I go on holidays but this was a joke!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE - Bell boy squeezing zit in elavator!”
Reviews.Author: Bell1517
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews for this hotel prior to our stay but didn't believe that the hotel could be that bad but it was! The location is fantastic and couldnt have been better but that was the only advantage to staying at this hotel. The hotel is run down and under construction. The elevator didnt work, the noise was unbearable, the staff were unhelpful and the bell boy came to our room to fix the toilet and used his mobile and squeezed his spots in the elevator on the way!!!!! The breakfast was not worth getting up for..................need we go on. If you need a central location and a bed for the night then this is the hotel for you but if you want more then stay away. However Barcelona is an amazing city and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: snowdaddy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location with easy access to all the main attractions of the city.The downside is the early morning noise from the streets below . Being in the centre the outlook from the rooms is very restricted and dark . Breakfasts are plentyful but the quality is not brilliant. Overall the hotel is in need of a makeover but what the heck ,in this location at this price no one can complain.

Reviews.Title: “Good location;shame about the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2-22-2012kp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in June 2006. The hotel is situated on a road just of the Ramblas - so easy access after a long night out! The rooms are very small and dark. I had no view from my window. Well, that's if you don't count a wall! I would not recoomend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: eme_49
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel at all costs. Yes it is in a great location but to be honest, there are a hundred other hotels also in this area which have to be of better standard than this hotel. Never have I encountered such rude staff. Iit seems that if you are British (as my fiance is) they will be rude and arrogant and unhelpful and will ignore you. Being Australian, I seemed to be able to get a little bit of helpfulness from the staff but not much too be honest. The hotel to be blunt, stinks of sewerage. This smell seems to be present on all floors the floors, in the two rooms we stayed in and even in the lift. I know Barcelona isn't renowned for having the best drainage system but this was so bad it left you feeling physically ill. After our first night we requested to change rooms after the room wehad had a broken shower head, broken mini bar, no tv reception, broken sink and cracks in the walls that left me in shock that the building was still standing. Our next room which appeared to be an upgrade was a bit better although the toilet seat was broken in half and you had to leave the windows open all the time to avoid being suffocated by the stench of the drains. All the rooms are smoking rooms even if you request a non smoking room although this tends to be a common problem in main land Europe. All in all, I have stayed in backpackers that are of higher standard and half the price. I would never return to this hotel and by no means could I recommend this hotel nor its staff to anyone. Avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful City Break”
Reviews.Author: whimbrelboy
Reviews.Content: The is a Wonderful old Hotel in the Gothic side of Barcelona, 3 minute walk from the popular La Ramblas, 2 minutes from the Cathedral & 15 minutes from the beach. Yes the rooms decor was showing signs of age but this only added to the gothic charm. Our rooms had balconies over the narrow street to soak in the atmosphere. Rooms were clean and tidy, most staff are bi-lingual and could not do enough to help. Our kids 18,13 & 5 enjoyed the stay. Good continental breakfast. Would Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Totally recommend this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte87
Reviews.Content: When i booked this hotel i was quite worried as i had read some not so good reviews!! but i arrived home from the rialto lastnite and i have to say that i had no complaints what so ever!! When we arrived the staff were very friendly and helpful and it only took us a few minutes to check in. The hotel room was a good size as there was three of us staying in the same room, but there was plenty of space! The only thing i will say is that when we walked past other rooms some of them did look on the small size but we obviously got one of the biggest because there was 3 of us. I suppose its the luck of the draw what room you are given, we stayed in room 428! The room was cleaned every day and new bedding, towels etc without fail! I would 100% recommend this hotel, it has lots going for it! Fantastic location, clean and friendly and the breakfast in the morning keeps you going until tea time! Its sort of down a little high street so when you are walking down there be extra careful for pickpockets beacuse i got my bag pinched off my arm just down the road!! but that could happen anywhere in barcelona!! Overall i rate this 10 out of 10!!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: countb
Reviews.Content: This really is an awful place, dirty room, rude staff & a desperatley bad breakfast. Please do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “as we expected”
Reviews.Author: daleman
Reviews.Content: we wanted a good value hotel close to the Ramblas and that's exactly what we got. We stayed room only so can't comment on the food. The place is decaying a bit with the odd light fitting askew in the lobby, one of the elevators out of action, and the other one's handrail secured by a bit of wire. Reception staff were efficient but seemed a little disinterested The rooms were neat and clean and the plumbing mostly worked OK. Couldn't fault the maid service. Only 5 mins walk from the Ramblas. We were quite happy with our choice and thought it good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Run from the Rialto!!”
Reviews.Author: Cnoodles
Reviews.Content: As others have highlighted this hotel is in a great location unfortunatley the room was horrible and fully at odds with the plush reception. Our room was extremely small, dark (we had one of those wall facing views) with cracked walls, peeling paint, broken mini bar, broken toilet seat and dirty burnt bed covers. There was no hairdryer. It was just really shabby and run down and I wouldn't consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “NOTHING IN THE HOTEL TOOK AWAY FROM THE BARCELONA EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: KAWASAKI ER5
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a long week-end with a group of friends, only had a problem with one of the four rooms which was changed with no arguement. rest were fine, and clean, plumbing slightly ancient, get what you pay for. There is so much to see in barcelona therefore did not spend too much time in room so not bothered if the view out the window was not very good. For breakfast there was a lot of choice, although it sometimes took a while for an item that ran out to be replaced. Nothing about the hotel took away from the Barcelona experience so no major complaints. I doubt you could get a more central position with everything close to hand.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: fromdenile
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Rialto at 5:00 a.m. on the day of check-in and were given a room early, which was great as we had been travelling the entire night. Unfortunately, the room had to have been the tiniest in the hotel as there was a double bed pushed against a wall and only about a foot of clearance around it on the one side and at the foot. The bathroom was a steep step down and small. I asked if it would be possible to change rooms since we would be staying for 6 nights and the desk clerk said that should be possible later in the day. (At that time, other people were also asking for room changes.) Later in the day, the clerk told us that there weren't any free rooms, but that we could stay at their 4 star sister hotel, the Gran Barcino, for the same price. It was only one block away and the room was spacious and quiet. I would not reserve a room at the Rialto again, but was greatly impressed by the degree of customer service. I definitely would book at the Gran Barcino.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe the poor reviews”
Reviews.Author: Bodecas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rialto back in 1999 and 2000 and said that if I went back to Barcelona I would certainly book there again. Well came 2006 and I decided on another visit and booked through my agent. After booking I looked through the review page nad was disappointed to see some of the comments and wondered if the Hotel had gone 'downhill'. I had no need to worry, the staff were helpful, the room although on the small size was adequate for our needs and the breakfast was far better than some better rated hotels I have been to. For the price of £40 a night Band B it was great value. It was clean, and it's siting was second to none. If I had a complaint it would be that during the few days I chose to go, Chelsea were playing Barcelona and the noise at night permeated everywhere. This is not the Hotels fault but it meant a rather sleepless night on the Tuesday. Overall, a good, clean, above average hotel with a great command of the city's features. Close to the Metro, Port, Ramblas, Placa Catalunya (where all day tours seem to start from). If I go back, I will certainly book there again (for the 4th time).

Reviews.Title: “Moderate hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Bilgen
Reviews.Content: We have been in Hotel Rialto for the last week of September. Although the hotel has a great location, there were also some disadvantages: 1. The rooms were not only small but also very dark. We couldn't understand the difference between the morning and the night. 2. The furniture of the room was very very old. I can understand the "historical building" but the furnitures can be renewed. 3. Unlike many hotels in the same category, there weren't a hairdryer in the room which can be a problem especially for ladies. I have seen many women in the breakfast with wet hair and angry face. 4. I personally didn't like the breakfast very much. Maybe it is because the breakfast buffet was at the depressive basement of the building, without a window and air. 5. We have gone with my husband and couldn't get a frenchbed. Moreover, we had a terrible waist pain during the stay because of the "state of the art" beds. That's all. I hope these help you to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: shesam
Reviews.Content: We had read the somewhat scathing reviews of this hotel prior to our visit and basically expected the worse. BUT we absolutely loved it. The location is perfect, the hot buffet breakfast excellent, all of the statt were polite and extremely helpful (always a smile and a hola) - nothing was too much trouble for them. Yes - the rooms are small, but lets face it, how long are you planning to spend in your room when you have this brilliant city to explore!!! and yes, the plumbing and decor were a little suspect, but this is the price you pay for a place with a bit of character!! Yes - the rooms have no view to speak of and we were subjected to a night or two of disturbed sleep due to rowdy party goers in the courtyard and street - but this is a large city and you have to reasonably expect some noise. Let's face it - you're on holiday and can stay in bed a little longer in the morning if you have to (and the breakfast is served up to 10:30 - so no problem !!!) If you want a modern, clinical hotel, don't stay here. If you want a great central location, great hot buffet breakfast, friendly and helpful staff and a bit of character - this is the place for you. We stayed for 5 very enjoyable nights and would have loved to stay longer. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location!!! great lobby!!”
Reviews.Author: debyholmes
Reviews.Content: the rialto is on 'calle ferran' one of the main shopping streets in barcelona and close to the subway stations, la rambla and many restaurants and bars. the room however was a disappointment. the phone did not work.the A/C did not work. i told them about it and they were prompt to try and fix it but it was not fixable so they moved me to another room. (with no help) the corridors were run down, carpet worn, paint peeling. small rooms. the suizo hotel was literally around the corner from the rialto and a much better deal. (both hotels were the same price) the room was bigger and nicer, bigger bathroom. both hotels are in a fabulous location and that being my main motivation- to be in the gothic quarter- i was happier with the suizo and would recommend it to thrifty travellers. for those wanting luxury-look elsewhere!!! still, a great location cannot be denied!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms are poor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights at this hotel.Great location near theRamblas.Room was very dark as my window didn´t have a view! Room was also a bit on the small side. Overall, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, but hotel not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Kathleentjev
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four-day trip to Barcelona. The Rialto hotel is on Carrer Ferran, in the heart of the Gothic quarter: a wonderful location with many restaurants and typical shops nearby. Rambla within 5 minutes walking distance, although I think this is not the best bit of Barcelona (still don't understand what everybody likes about this tourist trap). I know many trip advisor-members complain about the noise in the Rialto, especially when you have a room in the front of the hotel. Our room was on the 5th floor, so the noise was bearable. I thought I had been smart, bringing my ear plugs, but on the second day the room maid threw the little box (with plugs in it) away. I sometimes had the impression that the cleaning staff spent more time re-arranging our pajamas (putting them in odd, sexy shapes, like in the window of a fashion store) than actually cleaning. The room itself was shabby and worn-out: big parts of the paint had come off, due to - we think - moisture problems, the beds were very noisy (no further comment ;)), but worst of all was the bathroom: it was impossible to controll the temperature of the water: it went from very cold to very hot in no time, and vice versa, without touching anything. The water from the tap in the sink went in every direction but the sink, and for a shower two people were needed: the one that was taking the shower, and someone to constantly pull up the tap handle that controlls the switching between water coming out of the tap or out of the shower (if you released it, the shower stopped). I still wonder what anyone travelling alone would have to do to take a decent shower! The young people (students?) at the reception desk were friendly, the older man (manager?) was not friendly or helpful at all. Would I recommend Barcelona and the Gothic Quarter as a destination? Yes, yes, yes!!! Would I recommend this hotel? Since the only good part of it is the location: definitely not. Here is an extra tip for anyone driving to Barcelona and desperately in search of a parking place that doesn't ruin you: you can park without any cost on the streets in the former olympic village of Barcelona (around Avinguda Icaria). The reception-man wouldn't help us on this subject, but a very friendly girl in the tourist information center on Placa Ferran made this suggestion. We were of course very grateful and spent the saved money on a lovely tapas dinner! With Riojan wine, of course!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms on small side”
Reviews.Author: Artemis-Angel
Reviews.Content: The location is great minutes from Las Ramblas. I found the staff polite and helpful. Good buffet breakfast. Rooms clean but the single room I had was very small with only a small window, but given the hotel's city location not that unusual. Plumbing was interesting, though I did have plenty of hot water. Would stay again purely due to location.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best!”
Reviews.Author: els37
Reviews.Content: This is a mixed review in so much as the location is a good & a bad thing. Good because only a minute away from Las Ramblas & Plaza mayor etc but it's right next to the town hall etc, so when we stayed there was some sort of demonstration going on and so the street right outside the Rialto was full of armed police and about 10 police vans.Lots of shouting & crowds, quite alarming! I went a 2nd time (not staying at the Rialto) and the local roller hockey! team had just won some championship, so again everyone congregated outside the town hall to welcome home the team, very noisy. Things like this happening are obviously not everyday occurences, just seem to happen when I'm there! The hotel itself was ok not great. We had rooms at the front which seemed great at first with a small balcony. Then night time came and the noise is unbelievable lots of noisy, people passing ALL night (no exaggeration) & also the bin men turned up about 3am. My room was ok, nothing special but the other room my friends were in absolutely reeked when they put the air conditioning on, so they just slowly melted at night!Even so, they said they would stay there again, I wouldn't (& haven't).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, basic but clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel mainly because of it's location and wasn't disapointed. It's got a fantastic position in the heart of the gothic quarter a few minutes from the Ramblas, plaza Catalunya and the port. The room was small and functional but very clean. The hotel was very busy and the breakfast was good. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: goldfish1
Reviews.Content: Good location, spacious room. Ideal location for most of the attractions and shops and bars nearby. Breakfast is included, but sometimes we felt last nights dinner was being re-heated! Plenty of choice though. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “rude staff”
Reviews.Author: ebrunur
Reviews.Content: I had a six days of holiday at the beginning of July and I stayed in Rialto Hotel.I arrived late at night after a delayed flight. When I came to the reception,there wasn't any welcome or "hello", the staff were really very rude and indifferent.I was given a room on the sixth floor without a window!There was only a small piece of glass on the ceiling from which light came inside the room at 6 o'clock in the morning!Most of the nights,when I came back to my room,the door was locked and I had to go six floors down to take a card to open my door.When I asked the reason,they couldn't explain as most of the staff didn't know English well.They had the same unfriendly attitude in the restaurant where we were having breakfast.The only nice thing about Rialto is its location.It is very close to Las Ramblas. But still, I would definitely not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Many problems...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Elevators never worked. Neither did our room keys. Floors in our room were filthy. Showerheads were ancient and pitiful. View of a dirty alley. Beds did not look as if they were stripped daily. The only good thing I can say is that the staff was pleasant (except for an extremely rude "host" in the buffet area), and the area is convenient to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rialto”
Reviews.Author: Jalenis
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Rialto two weeks ago with my two daughters aged 14 & 5. The location is excellent, walking distance from Las Ramblas, La Boqueria, Cathedral, Darsenas Reales, Museum of History of the City and nice brasseries and shops. But the main problem is the room, it is hot and they told us the air conditioning system in the hotel is not activated until the month of June. We left on the 29th of May, so I guess that staying there now is not a problem. The breakfast buffet is very good and the personnel at the counter is courteous all the time. I'd stay there again but not in May.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: Dorothysmate
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed at the Rialto in central Barca in march. Great location - couldn't be faulted for centralness to Las Ramblas and to the city in general. My room was excellent - overlooking the street with a small balcony, but my friends was dreadful with a window that was frosted glass with a view over the bins! For the price it was pretty good value but the hotel staff could be better. We couldn't get an extra pillow after 9pm on our first night as "the cupboard is locked at 6pm!!" cleanliness was of a good standard and the bar in the cellar was cosy.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal position”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location between Cathedral (200m) and the famous Rambla(500m) yet in safe quieter side street. Take rooms on side or rear. Tourist class accomodation but adequate. My twin room was small for two and air conditioning barely adequate. Staff neither gushing nor aloof. Breakfast at 12 euros is pricey for what is available better to pop out to local cafe. Bathroom tired and towels grey! but clean and fresh. For the money I recommend this because of it position and has all the things needed. Note pedestrian area of the Rambla means in the evening taxis cannot approach and a walk may be required.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: andecc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Rialto four times, so I must like it. It is ideal for the Ramblas, the Barrio Gothic which includes the cathedral and the many little alleyways that need to be explored. It is only a short walk to Liceu Metro station on the Ramblas and not much further to the Placa de Catalunya where you can get the bus too and from the airport. There are superb late night bars in the area but the prices are becoming more and more expensive. Back to the hotel, the reception is very nice and the rooms are clean and tidy but the corridors are a maze, but easy when you've done it once providing you are sober. On my last visit in December 2004, we were on the first floor (can't recall the room number) and when we went into the room for a late afternoon siesta before the night ahead, I couldn't rest for what turned out to be a ghetto blaster in the shop below. It was nothing to do with the hotel and was in a clothes shop two doors to the right of the main entrance when you look at it from the street. I have stayed at other places in Barcelona and paid a lot more money but been less satisfied. For me, this is reasonably priced and in the best area you can get, but don't expect perfection. It is very clean and I would recommend you try it unless you are very rich and want a first class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in the middle of town”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the senter of things this hotel is well situated. The rooms are a bit old but clean. Good breakfast buffet, and nice staff. The best thing is still that you can reach almost everthing by foot!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: HRobinson827
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated for exploring Barcelona. Our room was immaculate and the staff were friendly. The rooms were very reasonably priced. The only downside is that it is noisy at night- however, that's a small price to pay to be in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “VFM”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights April 13 thro to 17th,£70 per/night.Absolutely no problems,17 Euros by Taxi from Airport.Staff very helpful, room worth the money because I've paid more in other Cities,you would do well to find anywhere better located.Hot water ok, didn't try the air/conn.Try and get room away from the front as it can still be quite noisy.Would have been nice if there had been some brew equipment in the room,will take a travel kettle on my next visit and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm.....Okay but not the best we've been to in Barcelona....!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok.... like others, after reading the reviews we were a little nervous but prepared to be open minded. We've been to Barcelona before. I'd asked for a room at the front of the hotel with a balcony which afforded a great view, but came at a price.in terms of noise....dustbin men around 3am etc. Very narrow streets make for lots of echoes....! The Celtic fans didn't help either... we were near many of the irish bars....The room was very small - I had to walk sideways to get into bed... there was a large crack down the wall as well. The bathroom was so small that when I sat on the loo, I could have brushed my teeth at the sink in front of me... Had hot water though - no problems there. There was an incredibly strong drains smell in the toilet - there's a drain in the middle of the floor for cleaning and I'm not sure if that's where it came from. For those that have visited Barca before, it's aroma is just one of those things you learn to expect, but to have it lurking in your bathroom is not pleasant. We had to keep the toilet door closed when not in use else it became overpowering. We had to keep the windows closed at night in a feeble attempt to stop some of the noise - it doesn't work. Our room was not soundproofed - either windows or the walls either side. The air conditioning was fine when it worked, but kept causing the circuit breaker to kick in.... not sure why at all! We had to fix our toilet to stop it continuously filling. Bed linens changed daily IF you remember to put the card saying 'please make up my room' on your door. We didn't have one of these to begin with, and were not told to do this, therefore causing a run in with the maid, the housekeeper and the reception manager who tried to say it was our fault for not doing what we should have. I pointed out that a) if we had a card it would be useful, and b) who was supposed to tell us this rule! It was sorted promptly once they proved we had no card in the room. Breakfast is full of choice, but I had problems with the cold milk tasting sour every day.... which was odd as the hot milk didn't. The bar is very friendly and remarkably cheap! Carmen is a gem! We had no problems with staff attitude at reception (apart from the misunderstanding re room cleaning!). Overall, the hotel reminded me of hotels in London - a little faceless, dealing with many nationalities and a little tired. We paid Â£70 for the room per night including breakfast. Final advice if you've booked - take an air freshner and ear plugs just in case:-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't know what the fuss is about above average 3* with excellent location. Bar in hotel quite quiet so consequently staff appear miserable. Lots of cafes, bars & restaurants nearby. Very nice upmarket wine bar type establishment next door. About 2 min walk to La Rambla. Rooms tend to be average size but without views - the windows tend to overlook enclosed courtyards and consequently the rooms are quite dark. If you've got breakfast booked its a buffet style so something for everyone if not probably not worth 11euros

Reviews.Title: “Stay here it's OK”
Reviews.Author: fireantsheaven
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK:VERY well located,brilliant buffet breakfast and more than adequate quad room.Nice and clean and linens changed daily.Only prob was a bit of noise at night but you must expect that in central city.Beggers?If you don't want to see beggars,ripoffs,pickpockets,and street thieves stay at home-certainly stay away from London,which has a much nastier atmosphere than Barca!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found this review website the day before departure, which left us extremely apprehensive. Needn't have been. Stayed for 3 nights in January 2004. Room cleaned every day, including a change of bedding. Plentifull hot water 24 hours a day even though hotel was fuly occupied. The air-con worked and we found all staff very friendly and willing to help where possible. There were beggars in the area (like any major city) but this was more than made up for by the hotel's excellent location. I would suggest it depends on your expectations, as to whether you will be dissapointed. We arrived expecting the worst and were pleasantly surpised. Definitely not a 4*, but a justified 2-3*. Lets face it, you don't visit Barcelona to stay in your hotel room for the whole vacation. We would happily recommend this hotel to anyone travelling on an average sized budget.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay at the Rialto! Terrific Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At first I was uneasy about staying here after reading the reviews, but I got a good deal so I couldn't resist trying it out. It definitely is not a 4* hotel, however the location is wonderful! It is walking distance to Las Ramblas and the Cathedral! Perfect location for a day of walking and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but certainly not great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Rialto for three nights in November. Our room was fine but we asked to move as there was no opening window and the room was very stuffy - what a mistake! The next room was awful. Water was either scolding hot or not warm enough for a shower, the bathroom was minute, the wardrobe doors couldn't open as there wasn't enough room, the extraction in the bathroom wasn't working at all ..... the list goes on. We did tell them when we left but the receptionist said some of the rooms had been modernised, some not. Obviously this one was a NOT. Our friends were perfectly happy. Maid service was good, but staff overall not very friendly. VERY well situated though noisy at night.
